luxatio: <entryFree id="n27304" type="gloss" key="luxa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luxātĭo</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">stre/mma</foreign>, i. q. luxatura, <sense id="n27304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dislocation, luxation</hi>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
luxatura: <entryFree id="n27305" type="main" key="luxa_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luxātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>luxo</etym>, <sense id="n27305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dislocation, luxation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
luxo: <entryFree id="n27306" type="main" key="luxo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luxo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">loco/s</foreign>, slanting, akin to obliquus, limus, licinus</etym>, <sense id="n27306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put out of joint, to dislocate</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27306.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxatum si quod est, sanum faciet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxata in locum reponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 104:18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 104, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">articulis luxatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 9, 23, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxata corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 6, 37, § 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27306.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to put out of place, displace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxare vitium radices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxatae machinae,</quote> <trans><tr>fallen apart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxata cornua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 45, 70, § 179</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
luxor: <entryFree id="n27307" type="main" key="luxor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luxor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>luxus</etym>, <sense id="n27307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to riot, revel, live luxuriously</hi>: luxantur a luxu dictum, id est luxuriantur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=120" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 120</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 55, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxantur, lustrantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 5</bibl></cit> Fleck.</sense></entryFree>
luxuria: <entryFree id="n27308" type="main" key="luxu^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luxŭrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">luxŭrĭēs</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype> (v. Zumpt, Verr. 2, 2, 3, § 7, and 2, 5, 31, § 80; Roby, Gram. § 342; old <sense id="n27308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> luxurii, Gracch. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 14</bibl>; the <case>dat.</case> of the fifth decl. is not in use, and the <case>abl.</case> is doubtful; v. Neue, Formenl. 1, 382 sqq.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>luxus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">rankness</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27308.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">rankness, luxuriance</hi> of trees and plants: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuriem segetum tenerā depascit in herbā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vitis luxuria se consumpserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 181</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 2, 1, § 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27308.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf., of animals: <hi rend="ital">wantonness, friskiness, frolicsomeness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:65" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 65</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27308.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">riotous living, extravagance, profusion, luxury, excess</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam ecfliges, luxuriae sumptus suppeditare ut possies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:4:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 4, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus, qui nunc luxuriā et lasciviā diffluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in urbe luxuries creatur, ex luxuriā existat avaritia, necesse est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:27:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 27, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odit populus Romanus privatam luxuriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:36:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 36, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuries Hannibalem ipsum Capuae corrupit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diffluere luxuriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 30, 106</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 34, 123</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res ad luxuriam pertinentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevior armis Luxuria incubuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:293" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 293</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis ferat istas luxuriae sordes?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:140" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 140</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n27308.4" n="B" level="2"> Of style: <cit><quote lang="la">in qua (oratione), ut in herbis, in summā ubertate inest luxuries quaedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:23:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 23, 96</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
luxurio: <entryFree id="n27309" type="main" key="luxu^ri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luxŭrĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">luxŭ-rĭor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 7</bibl>) [luxuria], <sense id="n27309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be rank, luxuriant, abound to excess</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n27309.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager assiduā luxuriabat aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:644" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 644</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuriat Phrygio sanguine pinguis humus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cacumina virgarum ne luxurientur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne (caules) in frondem luxurient,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 6, 34, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in patulas comas, Ov. de Nuce, 20: ut seges in pingui luxuriabit humo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:A. A. 1:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 360</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27309.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27309.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To wanton, sport, skip, bound, frisk</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(equus) luxurians,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:497" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 497</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuriat pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:156" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leo luxurians,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:613" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 613</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27309.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To have in abundance</hi> or <hi rend="ital">excess, to abound in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuriatque toris animosum pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciem Deliciis decet luxuriare novis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 191</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27309.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To swell, enlarge, grow rapidly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra luxuriant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 292</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27309.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27309.7" n="A" level="2"> Of style or language, <hi rend="ital">to be luxuriant, to be too fruitful, to run riot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuriantia compescet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 122</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuriantia astringere (stilo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:4:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27309.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To be wanton</hi> or <hi rend="ital">licentious, to indulge to excess, to revel, run riot, be dissolute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne luxuriarentur otio animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 19</bibl></cit>: Capuam luxuriantem felicitate, id, 23, 2; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:15" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertate luxuriare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:7:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 10, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: vereor ne haec laetitia luxuriet. <pb n="1089" /> <cb n="LYCA" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">usus luxuriantis aetatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 13, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
luxuriose: <entryFree id="n27310" type="main" key="luxu^ri^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luxŭrĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. luxuriosus <sense id="n27310.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
luxuriosus: <entryFree id="n27311" type="main" key="luxu^ri^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luxŭrĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>luxuria</etym>, <sense id="n27311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rank, luxuriant, exuberant</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27311.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:24:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 24, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:690" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 690</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis valida et luxuriosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:36" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:21:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 21, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27311.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27311.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Immoderate, excessive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxurioso otio esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27311.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Immoderate, extravagant, wanton</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuriosissimum dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 746</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27311.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Excessive, profuse, luxurious, voluptuous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reprehendere luxuriosos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:7:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa et lauta supellex, non illa quidem luxuriosi hominis, sed tamen abundantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:27:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 27, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil luxuriosius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:27:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 27, 66</bibl></cit>: homines luxuriosi prodigi (vocantur), Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=250" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 250</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:77" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 77</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">luxŭrĭōsē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n27311.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Wantonly, immoderately, excessively</hi>: ne haec laetitia nimis luxuriose eveniat, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27311.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Luxuriously, voluptuously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum libidinosis luxuriose vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum luxuriose habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 11</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuriosius epulari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 3</bibl></cit>: struere fercula, Col. prooem.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxuriosissime bibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Mor. Eccl. Cath. 34" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Mor. Eccl. Cath. 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
luxus: <entryFree id="n27312" type="greek" key="luxus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luxus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>= Gr. <foreign lang="greek">loco/s</foreign>; v. luxo</etym>, <sense id="n27312.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dislocated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxum si quod est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 160</bibl></cit>: luxo pede, Sall. Fragm. ap. Prob. p. 1476 P. (Hist. 5, 2); cf.: luxa membra e suis locis mota et soluta, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=119:17" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 119, 17</bibl> Müll.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">luxum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a dislocation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">emplastrum utile ad luxa, vel fracta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27313" type="main" key="luxus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luxus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. luxus</etym>, <sense id="n27313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dislocation</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ad luxum aut fracturam alliga: sanum fiet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 160</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 354 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 2, 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27314" type="main" key="luxus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">luxus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (<case>dat.</case> luxu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 71</bibl>) [root luc-; cf. pol-luceo, pol-lucte; v. Corss. Ausspr. 1, 368 sq.]. <sense id="n27314.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Excess, extravagance</hi> in eating and drinking, <hi rend="ital">luxury, debauchery</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescens luxu perditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vino ac luxu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:25:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 25, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid luxu antecapere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxu atque desidiā corrupta civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luxu et saginae mancipatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per luxum et ignaviam aetatem agere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>luxuriously and slothfully</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitiosus, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 5, 3, 2: turpi fregerunt saecula luxu divitiae molles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:299" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 299</bibl></cit>.— In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum translatos Romana in saecula luxus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">combibat illapsos ductor per viscera luxus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:402" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 402</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n27314.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Splendor, pomp, magnificence, state</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at domus interior regali splendida luxu Instruitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:637" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 637</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epulaeque ante ora paratae Regifico luxu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 604</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eruditus luxus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lyaeus: <entryFree id="n27315" type="main" key="Ly^aeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lyaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*luai=os</foreign>, <sense id="n27315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Lyæus, the relaxer, unbender, deliverer from care</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27315.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A surname of Bacchus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patri Lyaeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corniger Lyaeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:15:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 15, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 274</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:229 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 229 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n27315.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">wine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uda Lyaeo Tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Curam Dulci Lyaeo solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 9, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illic apposito narrabis multa Lyaeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:11:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 11, 49</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lyaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: regales inter mensas laticemque Lyaeum, <hi rend="ital">the Lyæan liquid</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:686" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 686</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lycabas: <entryFree id="n27316" type="main" key="Ly^ca^bas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycăbas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*luka/bas</foreign>. <sense id="n27316.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Tuscan who fled from his country on account of a murder, and who, for a slight shown to Bacchus, was changed into a dolphin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:624" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 624</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27316.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Assyrian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27316.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Centaur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 302</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lycaeus: <entryFree id="n27317" type="main" key="Ly^caeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lukai=os</foreign>, <sense id="n27317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Arcadia</hi> (now <hi rend="ital">Dhiaforti</hi>), <hi rend="ital">where Jupiter and Pan were worshipped</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 6, 10, § 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:539" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 539</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 217</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 18, 17; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8, 343</bibl> and 344: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa Lycaei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 15</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27317.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Lycean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Panos de more Lycaei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 344</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:698" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 698</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:317" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pan</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:533" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 533</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lycambes: <entryFree id="n27318" type="main" key="Ly^cambes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycambes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*luka/mbhs</foreign>, <sense id="n27318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Theban who promised his daughter to Archilochus, and afterwards refused her; for which he was pursued by the poet with such bitter sarcasm that he hung both himself and his daughter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualis Lycambae spretus infido gener,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:6:13" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 6, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 30</bibl>. <cb n="LYCI" /> —Hence, </sense><sense id="n27318.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycambēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Lycambes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:54" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 54</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lycaon: <entryFree id="n27319" type="main" key="Ly^ca_on1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycāon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*luka/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n27319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Arcadia, father of Callisto, whom Jupiter, because he had defiled his altar with human sacrifices, turned into a wolf;</hi> acc. to Ovid, <hi rend="ital">because he had tried to murder Jupiter himself, who was his guest</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 198</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 176 sq" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 176 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 10, 10</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Lycaona, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 526</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27319.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">His grandson</hi>, also called Arcas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:225" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 225</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27319.2" n="II" level="1"> </sense><sense id="n27319.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycāŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Lycaon, Lycaonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:433" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 433</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parens,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Callisto</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 496</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arctos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Callisto as the constellation of the Bear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:793" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 793</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 235</bibl>. —Hence, axis, <hi rend="ital">the northern sky</hi>, where the constellation of the Bear is situated, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:2:2" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 2, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27319.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycāŏnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the daughter of Lycaon</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Callisto</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:173" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 173</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27320" type="main" key="ly^ca_on2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lycāon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">luka/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n27320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an animal of the wolf kind</hi>, Mela, 3, 9, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 34, 52, § 123</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lycaones: <entryFree id="n27321" type="main" key="Ly^ca_o^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycāŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*luka/ones</foreign>, <sense id="n27321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Lycaonians, a people of Asia Minor, between Cappadocia, Cilicia, and Pisidia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 29, § 105</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27321.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycāŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Lycaonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lycaoniumque Ericeten,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:749" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 749</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n27321.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycāŏnia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Lycaonians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:54:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 54, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:39" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 14, 6</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycāŏnĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the dialect of Lycaonia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 14, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lycaonis: <entryFree id="n27322" type="main" key="Ly^ca_o^nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycāŏnis</orth>, <itype>idis</itype>, v. 1. Lycaon, II. B.</entryFree>
lycaonius: <entryFree id="n27323" type="main" key="Ly^ca_o^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycāŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. Lycaon, II. A. and Lycaones.</entryFree>
lycapsos: <entryFree id="n27324" type="main" key="ly^capsos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lycapsos</orth>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lu/kayos</foreign>, <sense id="n27324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">alkanet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 11, 73, § 97</bibl> (al. lycopsis).</sense></entryFree>
lycaunus: <entryFree id="n27325" type="main" key="Ly^cau_nu^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycaūnŭs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a warrior</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:203" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 203</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lyce: <entryFree id="n27326" type="main" key="Ly^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lu/kh</foreign>, <sense id="n27326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 13, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lyceum: <entryFree id="n27327" type="main" key="Ly^ce_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycēum</orth>, v. Lycium.</entryFree>
lychnicus: <entryFree id="n27328" type="greek" key="lychni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lychnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">luxniko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n27328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">luminous, shining</hi>: lapis, <hi rend="ital">a kind of white marble, also called</hi> lychnites, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 223" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 223</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lychnidum: <entryFree id="n27329" type="main" key="Lychni^dum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lychnĭdum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lychnĭdus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*luxnido/s</foreign>, <sense id="n27329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Illyria, near the Haliacmon, in the territory of the Dessaretes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:9" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes">10</bibl>; 21.</sense></entryFree>
lychnion: <entryFree id="n27330" type="greek" key="lychni^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lychnĭon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">luxni/on</foreign>, <sense id="n27330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lamp, light</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 17, 9, 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lychnis: <entryFree id="n27331" type="greek" key="lychnis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lychnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <sense id="n27331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">luxni/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">lightgiving, shining</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27331.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: lychnides puellae, <hi rend="ital">girls with lamps</hi>, Fulg. Myth. prooem. 1.—</sense><sense id="n27331.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lychnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n27331.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of rose of a fiery red</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27331.4" n="B" level="2"> Lychnis agria, another plant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 10, 80, § 129</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27331.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A gem of a fiery color</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 29, § 103</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lychnites: <entryFree id="n27332" type="greek" key="lychni_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lychnītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">luxni/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n27332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of white marble</hi>, which was quarried in the Isle of Paros by lamp-light, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lychnitis: <entryFree id="n27333" type="greek" key="lychni_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lychnītis</orth>, <itype>ītĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">luxni=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n27333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant from which wicks were made</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 10, 74, § 121</bibl></sense></entryFree>
lychnobius: <entryFree id="n27334" type="greek" key="lychno^bi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lychnŏbĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">luxno/bios</foreign>, <sense id="n27334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who lives by lamp-light, who turns night into day</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 122:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 122, 17</bibl>; v. lucifuga.</sense></entryFree>
lychnuchus: <entryFree id="n27335" type="greek" key="lychnu_chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lychnūchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">luxnou=xos</foreign>, <sense id="n27335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lamp-stand, candlestick, chandelier</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligneolus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pensiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 3, 8, § 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lychnus: <entryFree id="n27336" type="greek" key="lychnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lychnus</orth> (old Latinized form lucinus, Enn.; cf. Ritschl in Rhein. Mus. 10, p. 448 sq.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lu/xnos</foreign>, <sense id="n27336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a light, a lamp</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pendentes lychni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux alia est solis et lychnorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:28:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 28, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:726" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 726</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:520" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 520</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lycia: <entryFree id="n27337" type="main" key="Ly^ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycĭa</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Lŭcĭa</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 73</bibl> Fleck.), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*luki/a</foreign>, <sense id="n27337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a country of Asia Minor, between Caria and Pamphylia, where was the volcano Chimæra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:15:1" default="NO">1, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:4" default="NO">2, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 27, § 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chimaerifera Lycia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 340</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:200" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 200</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:721" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 721</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27337.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Lycian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pharetra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 816</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 773</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sortes,</quote> <trans><tr>the oracle of Apollo at Patara, in Lycia</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 346</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Apollo</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 1, 38; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 17</bibl>: <cb n="LYCO" /> catervae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the troops of Sarpedon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 8, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27337.2" n="B" level="2"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n27337.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Lycians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:10:section=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 10, § 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:15:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 15, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 5, 3</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n27337.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of thorn, the juice and roots of which were used medicinally</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:124 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 14, 76, § 124 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 6</bibl>; 9.</sense></entryFree>
lycidas: <entryFree id="n27338" type="main" key="Ly^ci^das"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycĭdas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*luki/das</foreign>, <sense id="n27338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Centaurs, who endeavored to carry off Hippodamia from Pirithoüs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 310</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n27338.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a beautiful boy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27338.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a shepherd</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 67</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lycimnia: <entryFree id="n27339" type="main" key="Ly^ci_mni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycīmnĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Lĭcȳm-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n27339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of the wife of a king of Lydia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:546" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 546</bibl> (al. Licymnia).</sense></entryFree>
lycimnius: <entryFree id="n27340" type="main" key="Ly^cimni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycimnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n27340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the town of Lycimna</hi> (in Argolis), <hi rend="ital">Lycimnian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stagna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:734" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 734</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lycinna: <entryFree id="n27341" type="main" key="Ly^cinna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycinna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n27341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a girl</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl>, (4), 13, 6.</sense></entryFree>
lycisca: <entryFree id="n27342" type="main" key="Ly^cisca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycisca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lyciscē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n27342.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a bitch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 220</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27342.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A vile woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:122" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 122</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lyciscus: <entryFree id="n27343" type="greek" key="ly^ciscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lyciscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">luki/skos</foreign>, <sense id="n27343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wolfdog</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lycisci dicuntur canes nati ex lupis et canibus, cum inter se forte miscentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27343.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lyciscus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the name of a beautiful boy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:24" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27343.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A boy whose statue was made by Leochares</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lycium: <entryFree id="n27344" type="main" key="Ly^ci^um1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycĭum</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Lycia, II.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27345" type="main" key="Ly^ci_um2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycīum</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycēum</orth>, v. Ellendt ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:21:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 21, 98</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lu/keion</foreign>, <sense id="n27345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gymnasium very near Athens, in which Aristotle taught</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:21:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 21, 98</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:13:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 13, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:24:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 24, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:5:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 5, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27345.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27345.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The upper gymnasium of Cicero's Tusculan villa, with a library in it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:5:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27345.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A gymnasium of the emperor Hadrian at his Tiburtine villa</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lyco: <entryFree id="n27346" type="main" key="Lyco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lyco</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Peripatetic philosopher, a follower of Strato of Lampsacus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:32:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 32, 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lycomedes: <entryFree id="n27347" type="main" key="Ly^co^me_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycŏmēdes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lukomh/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n27347.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of the Isle of Scyros, with whom Achilles concealed himself disguised in female attire, and whose daughter Deidamia bore to the latter Pyrrhus</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Neoptolemus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 20, 75</bibl> (where Neoptolemus is erroneously spoken of instead of Achilles); <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 207</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lycomedius: <entryFree id="n27348" type="main" key="Ly^co^me_dius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycŏmēdius</orth>, v. lucumo, II. A.</entryFree>
lyconides: <entryFree id="n27349" type="main" key="Ly^co_ni^de_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycōnĭdēs</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lycophon: <entryFree id="n27350" type="main" key="ly^co^phon1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lycŏphon</orth>, <sense id="n27350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, also called</hi> scelerata, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27351" type="main" key="Ly^co^pho_n2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycŏphōn</orth>, <itype>ōntis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a warrior</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:610" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 610</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lycophos: <entryFree id="n27352" type="greek" key="ly^co^pho_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lycŏphōs</orth>, <itype>ōtis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">luko:fws</foreign>, <sense id="n27352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the morning twilight</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 17, 37, p. 292</bibl> Bip.; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=121" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 121</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
lycophron: <entryFree id="n27353" type="main" key="Ly^co^phron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycŏphron</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*luko/frwn</foreign>, <sense id="n27353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Lycophron of Chalcis, in Eubœa, the author of Cassandra, an Alexandrine grammarian and tragedian of the time of Ptolemy Philadelphus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utque cothurnatum periisse Lycophrona narrant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:531" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 531</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latebrae Lycophronis atri, so called from his obscure style,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:157" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 157</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lycophthalmos: <entryFree id="n27354" type="greek" key="ly^cophthalmos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lycophthalmos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">luko/fqalmos</foreign> (wolf's-eye), <sense id="n27354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 72, § 187</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 16, 15, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lycopsis: <entryFree id="n27355" type="greek" key="ly^copsis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lycopsis</orth> (al. <orth extent="full" lang="la">lycapsos</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lukoyi/s</foreign>, <sense id="n27355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wild bugloss</hi>, a plant resembling the alkanet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 11, 73, § 97</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lycoreus: <entryFree id="n27356" type="main" key="Lyco_reus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycōreus</orth>, <itype>ei and eos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Apollo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 161" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 161</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lycorias: <entryFree id="n27357" type="main" key="Ly^co_ri^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycōrĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lukwria/s</foreign>, <sense id="n27357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seanymph, daughter of Nereus and Doris</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 339</bibl>; Hyg. Fab. praef.</sense></entryFree>
lycoris: <entryFree id="n27358" type="main" key="Ly^co_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycōris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype> (<case>acc.</case> -orida, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:537" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 537</bibl>; <case>voc.</case> Lycori, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:102:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 102, 1</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, also called Cythere, <sense id="n27358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a freedwoman of the senator Volumnius Eutrapelus, the mistress of Cornelius Gallus, and afterwards of Marc Antony</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:537" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 537</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:15:29 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 15, 29 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:445" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 445</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 25</bibl> (3, 32), 91; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:73:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 73, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lycormas: <entryFree id="n27359" type="main" key="Ly^cormas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycormas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*luko/rmas</foreign>, <sense id="n27359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river</hi> <pb n="1090" /> <cb n="LYDI" /> <hi rend="ital">of Ætolia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 245</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">afterwards called Chrysorrhoas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 242" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 242</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lycortas: <entryFree id="n27360" type="main" key="Ly^cortas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycortas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*luko/rtas</foreign>, <sense id="n27360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a general</hi> (strategos, <foreign lang="greek">strathgo/s</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">of the Achæan League</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36" default="NO" valid="yes">36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lycos: <entryFree id="n27361" type="greek" key="ly^cos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lycos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lu/kos</foreign>, <sense id="n27361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of spider</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">araneus, et maxume qui lycos vocatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 6, 17, § 52</bibl></cit>; <case>acc.</case> lycon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 11, 30, § 104</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lycotas: <entryFree id="n27362" type="main" key="Ly^co_tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycōtas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Centaurs at the wedding of Pirithoüs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 350</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n27362.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fictitious name of a man</hi>, probably meaning Postumius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 3, 1.</sense></entryFree>
lycotherses: <entryFree id="n27363" type="main" key="Ly^co^therses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycŏtherses</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of Illyria, whom his wife Agave, the daughter of Cadmus, murdered, in order to give the kingdom to her father</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 184" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:340" default="NO">340</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:254" default="NO">254</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lyctus: <entryFree id="n27364" type="main" key="Lyctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lyctus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lu/ktos</foreign>, <sense id="n27364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Crete, east of Gnossus, a colony of the Lacedæmonians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:12" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 59</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lyctĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Lyctus, Lyctian, Cretan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lyctius Idomeneus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 401</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Cretan</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:490" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 490</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lycurgus: <entryFree id="n27365" type="main" key="Ly^curgus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycurgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lukou=rgos</foreign>. <sense id="n27365.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Dryas, king of the Edones, who prohibited the worship of Bacchus to his subjects, and ordered all the vines to be destroyed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:16:23" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 16, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:386" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 386</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 132" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:242" default="NO">242</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27365.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Pheres, a king of Nemea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:39" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 39</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n27365.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Aleus and Neæra, and father of Ancæus, a king of Arcadia;</hi> hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ly-curgīdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a male descendant of Lycurgus</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Ancæus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:503" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 503</bibl>; and: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycŏorgīdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, the same, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 584</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n27365.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The famous lawgiver of the Spartans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:43:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 43, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 9, 5</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:22:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 22, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:6:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 6, 3</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n27365.4" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Athenian orator, the contemporary and friend of Demosthenes, famed for his incorruptible integrity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:34:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 34, 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:23:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 23, 94</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for <hi rend="ital">a severe magistrate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lycurgos invenisse se praedicabat et Cassios, columina justitiae prisca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 8, 13</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycur-gēi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lukou/rgeioi</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">disciples of Lycurgus, inflexibly severe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nosmetipsi, qui Lycurgei a principio fuissemus, cotidie demitigamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 13, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lycus: <entryFree id="n27366" type="main" key="Ly^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lycus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lu/kos</foreign>. <sense id="n27366.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Pandion, king of Lycia</hi>, Mela, 1, 15, 1.— </sense><sense id="n27366.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Theban, who, when Hercules descended into the Lower World, took possession of the sovereignty in Thebes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 31" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 31</bibl> and 32. —</sense><sense id="n27366.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Centaurs at the wedding of Pirithoüs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 332</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27366.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A companion of Diomedes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:504" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 504</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27366.4" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the companions of Æneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 222</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27366.5" n="VI" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An historian of Regium, the adoptive father of the tragic writer Lycophron; he wrote a history of Libya and Sicily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 19, § 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27366.6" n="VII" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of several rivers</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27366.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">In Bithynia, the Rhyndacus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kilij Su</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:47" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 10, 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27366.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">In Great Phrygia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 273</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27366.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">In Paphlagonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 367</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27366.10" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">In Cilicia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 22, § 91</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27366.11" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">In Ionia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 115</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27366.12" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river flowing into the Euphrates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 24, 20, § 84</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27366.13" n="VIII" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Illyrian city in the territory of the Dessaretes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lyde: <entryFree id="n27367" type="main" key="Ly_de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lȳdē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lu/dh</foreign>, <sense id="n27367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the wife of the poet Antimachus of Claros, who attempted to console himself for her death by an elegiac poem which he named Lyde</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Clario Lyde dilecta poëtae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:6:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27367.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a female quack-doctor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turgida condīta pyxide Lyde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:141" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 141</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lydia: <entryFree id="n27368" type="main" key="Ly_di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lȳdĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ludi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n27368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a country in Asia Minor, the capital of which was Sardis, the fabled original land of the Etruscans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 30, § 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 27, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:39:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 39, 16</bibl> et saep.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27368.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lȳdĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n27368.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Lydian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <trans><tr>of Gyges</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:199" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurifer amnis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pactolus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:3:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 15</bibl></cit> (4, 16), 30: <cit><quote lang="la">pensa,</quote> <trans><tr>which Omphale gave to Hercules</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:66:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 66, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nurus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Omphale</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oet. 371" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oet. 371</bibl></cit>: sil. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 13, 56, § 160</bibl>: lapis, <hi rend="ital">a touchstone</hi> (at first found only on the Tmolus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 8, 43, § 126</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">moduli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 204</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27368.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lydĭon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of brick</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 14, 49, § 171</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27368.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27368.5" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Etruscan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lydius fluvius,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Tiber</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:781" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 781</bibl></cit>: ripa, <hi rend="ital">the right bank of the</hi> <cb n="LYNC" /> <hi rend="ital">Tiber</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:4:6" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 4, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stagna,</quote> <trans><tr>the Trasimene Lake</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:11" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 11</bibl></cit>.—（<orth extent="full" lang="la">Lydii</orth>, false read. for ludii; v. ludius).—</sense><sense id="n27368.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Rhætian</hi> (because the Rhætians were descended from the Etruscans, the descendants of the Lydians): <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <trans><tr>the Lake Benacus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:31:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 31, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27368.7" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lȳdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Lydian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lydus servus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 27, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puella,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Omphale</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:365" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 365</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lydae pondera gazae (i. e. aurum Pactoli),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:60" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:369" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 369</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27368.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">Etrurian, Etruscan</hi>.— As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lȳdi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lydorum manus,</quote> <trans><tr>a band of Etruscans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lygdamus: <entryFree id="n27369" type="main" key="Lygda^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lygdămus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slave of Cynthia, the mistress of Propertius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 4</bibl> (4, 5), 2; 4 (5), 7, 43.</sense></entryFree>
lygdinus: <entryFree id="n27370" type="greek" key="lygdi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lygdĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">lu/gdinos</foreign>, <sense id="n27370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of white marble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">horoscopus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">lygdinus lapis,</quote> <trans><tr>a dazzling white marble found in the island of Paros</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 8, 13, § 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 5, 8</bibl> (the same as lygdos).</sense></entryFree>
lygdos: <entryFree id="n27371" type="greek" key="lygdos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lygdos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lu/gdos</foreign>, <sense id="n27371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a white stone</hi>, = lygdinus lapis: <cit><quote lang="la">candida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:13:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:42:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 42, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lygii: <entryFree id="n27372" type="main" key="Lygii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lygii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. Ligii.</entryFree>
lygmon: <entryFree id="n27373" type="main" key="Lygmon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lygmon</orth>, Müller's reading for Lucmo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:5:1:29" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 5, 1, 29</bibl>.</entryFree>
lygos: <entryFree id="n27374" type="greek" key="ly^gos1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lygos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lu/gos</foreign>, <sense id="n27374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, the chaste tree, agnus castus, Abraham's balm</hi> (in late Lat. vitex), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 9, 38, § 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27375" type="main" key="Ly^gos2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lygos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lu/gos</foreign>, <sense id="n27375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient name of Byzantium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum Byzantium ... antea Lygos dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> de Clar. Urb. Carm. 1, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lympha: <entryFree id="n27376" type="main" key="lympha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lympha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">nu/mfh</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n27376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">water;</hi> esp. clear river or spring water (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">lymphae puteales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluviali spargere lympha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:635" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 635</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 459</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnera lymphis abluere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:531" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 531</bibl></cit>.— Also, <hi rend="ital">the water</hi> in dropsical persons: <cit><quote lang="la">lympha intercus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 27, 501</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27376.1" n="II" level="1"> Personified: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lympha</orth>. </sense><sense id="n27376.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A rural deity, the goddess of water</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27376.3" n="B" level="2"> Lymphae, i. q. Nymphae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 97</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1639</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lymphaceus: <entryFree id="n27377" type="main" key="lympha_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lymphācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lympha</etym>, <sense id="n27377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clear as water, clear as crystal</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 569</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lymphaticus: <entryFree id="n27378" type="main" key="lympha_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lymphātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lympha; cf. hydrophobia; hence, in gen.</etym>, <sense id="n27378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">distracted, frantic, panic-struck</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavor,</quote> <trans><tr>a panic</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:28:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 28, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 17, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 13:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 13, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 34, § 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elleborum medetur melancholicis, insanientibus, lymphaticis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 5, 24, § 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27378.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27378.2" n="A" level="2"> Comically: <cit><quote lang="la">lymphatici nummi,</quote> <trans><tr>that cannot keep quiet in one's purse, as if mad</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 135</bibl></cit> Weise (al. lymphati).— </sense><sense id="n27378.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lymphātĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the disease of a</hi> lymphaticus, <hi rend="ital">insanity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">faxo actutum constiterit lymphaticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 136</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lymphatio: <entryFree id="n27379" type="main" key="lympha_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lymphātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>lympho</etym>, <sense id="n27379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">distraction, frenzy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 4, 15, § 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:151" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 15, 44, § 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lymphatus: <entryFree id="n27380" type="main" key="lympha_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lymphātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. lympho.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27381" type="main" key="lympha_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lymphātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lympho</etym>, <sense id="n27381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">madness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lympho: <entryFree id="n27382" type="main" key="lympho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lympho</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>lympha</etym>. <sense id="n27382.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To water, dilute with water</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">admixto vino lymphato, id est, aqua temperato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3:68" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 3, 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27382.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To drive out of one's senses, to distract with fear, to make mad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:47" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes incursibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:113" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac herba pota lymphari homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 164</bibl></cit>. —As <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lymphantes animi,</quote> <trans><tr>driven crazy, mad</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 12, 83, § 107</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">lymphātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., distracted, crazy, beside one's self, mad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum pavor invasit: quippe lymphati trepidare coeperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:12:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 12, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lymphati et attoniti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repente lymphati destrictis gladiis invadunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lymphatis caeco pavore animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine more furit lymphata per urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 377</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:557" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 557</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lymphato cursu ruere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:459" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 459</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
