lymphor: <entryFree id="n27383" type="main" key="lymphor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lymphor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">water</hi>: impermixtum lymphorem, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 212, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lyncaeste: <entryFree id="n27384" type="main" key="Lyncaeste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lyncaestē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n27384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of Actæon's hounds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 181" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 181</bibl>. <cb n="LYRI" /></sense></entryFree>
lyncestae: <entryFree id="n27385" type="main" key="Lyncestae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lyncestae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lugkhstai/</foreign>, <sense id="n27385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in the south-western part of Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:30:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 30, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 35</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n27385.1" n="II" level="1"> </sense><sense id="n27385.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lyncestĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Lyncestian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 329</bibl></cit>; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n27385.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lyncestis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <hi rend="ital">adj., Lyncestian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 230</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27385.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lyncestus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Lyncestian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lynceus: <entryFree id="n27386" type="main" key="Lynceus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lynceus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>), <itype>ĕi</itype> (<sense id="n27386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Lyncei, dissyl., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 90</bibl> Orell. ad loc.; <case>voc.</case> Lynceu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:32:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 32, 9</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lugkeu/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a Messenian, and one of the Argonauts, brother of Idas, and son of Aphareus, famed for the sharpness of his sight</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non possis oculo quantum contendere Lynceus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lyncei oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 2, 90</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:462" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 462</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 8</bibl>, n. 14; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 17, 15, § 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:711" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 711</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:34" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 34</bibl> (3, 32), 9.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27386.1" n="I" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lyncēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lu/gkeios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of Lynceus, Lyncean</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:709" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 709</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27386.2" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">sharp-sighted</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis est tam Lynceus, qui in tantis tenebris nihil offendat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27386.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lyncī-des</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a descendant of Lynceus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 99</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 767</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27386.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Ægyptus, and husband of Hypermnestra, who alone was saved by his wife when all his brothers were put to death</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> H 14, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 273" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 273</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27386.5" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Thestius, and brother of Althæa, who was slain by Meleager</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 173" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 173</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:174" default="NO">174</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27386.6" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the companions of Æneas; acc.</hi> Lyncĕă, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:768" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 768</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lyncurion: <entryFree id="n27387" type="greek" key="lyncu_ri^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lyncūrĭon</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lugkou/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n27387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hard, transparent gem, which, according to the opinion of the ancients, was formed of lynxes' urine;</hi> prob. <hi rend="ital">the hyacinth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tourmaline</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 38, 57, § 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:34" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 2, 11, § 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:52" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 3, 13, § 52</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 413</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 94</bibl>, n. 16.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">lyncūrĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 12, 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 4, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 8, 8</bibl> (al. ligurius); and <orth extent="full" lang="la">lĭgūrĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 64, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:28:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 28, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lyncus: <entryFree id="n27388" type="main" key="Lyncus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lyncus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lu/gkos</foreign>. <sense id="n27388.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Masc., a Scythian king, who attempted the life of his guest, Triptolemus, and was changed by Ceres into a lynx</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:650" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 650</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 259" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 259</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27388.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Fem., a city of Macedonia, the capital of the</hi> Lyncestae (q. v.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 25, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:33" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lynx: <entryFree id="n27389" type="greek" key="lynx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lynx</orth>, <itype>lyncis</itype>, <gen>com.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lu/gc</foreign>, <sense id="n27389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lynx</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lynces Bacchi variae (Bacchus was drawn by a team of lynxes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 264</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maculosae tegmine lyncis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 323</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lyncibus ad caelum vecta Ariadna tuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:15:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 15, 8</bibl></cit> (4, 16, 18): <cit><quote lang="la">colla lyncum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timidos agitare lyncas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dejectus lyncis,</quote> <trans><tr>a lynx-skin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:272" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 272</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lyo: <entryFree id="n27390" type="main" key="ly^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lyo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">lu/w</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n27390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make liquid, to liquefy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ptisanam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:4" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulpa lyata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:5:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lyra: <entryFree id="n27391" type="greek" key="ly^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lyra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lu/ra</foreign>, <sense id="n27391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lute, lyre</hi>, a stringed instrument resembling the cithara, fabled to have been invented by Mercury and presented to Apollo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:7" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">curvae lyrae parens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Threiciam digitis increpuisse lyram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mox cecinit laudes prosperiore lyrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:100" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 100</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27391.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27391.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Lyric poetry, song</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeoliae Lesbis amica lyrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:18:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 18, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 3, 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27391.3" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">poetic genius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Inferior lyra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:445" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 445</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27391.4" n="C" level="2"> Lyra, <hi rend="ital">the constellation, the Lyre</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exoriente Lyra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:315" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 315</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 3:6" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lyrceius: <entryFree id="n27392" type="main" key="Lyrce_i^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lyrcēĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lyrcēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n27392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., Lyrcean, of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">near the Mount Lyrceum</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">*lu/rkeion</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">between Arcadia and Argolis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:355" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 355</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lyrcea arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:598" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 598</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lyrcius: <entryFree id="n27393" type="main" key="Lyrci_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lyrcīus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lyrcēus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Lyrcaeus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fountain in the Peloponnesus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aret Lyrcius (Lyrceus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:711" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 711</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lyricen: <entryFree id="n27394" type="main" key="ly^ri^cen"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lyrĭcen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>lyra-cano</etym>, <sense id="n27394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a luteplayer, lyrist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidicen, lyricen, cornicen, liticen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Gramm. p. 1977" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Gramm. p. 1977</bibl></cit> P.; cf.: lyricen, <foreign lang="greek">lurw|do/s</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
lyricus: <entryFree id="n27395" type="main" key="ly^ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lyrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lyra</etym>, <sense id="n27395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the lute</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lyre, lyric</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lyrici soni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:94" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Anacreon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:364" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnator lyricae cohortis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pindar</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:7:5" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 7, 5</bibl></cit>.— <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n27395.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lyrĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">lyric poems</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 17, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 1, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27395.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">lyrĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <pb n="1091" /> <cb n="LYST" /> <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">luriko:s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a lyric poet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchylides,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 4, 3</bibl></cit>.—Usually <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">lyrĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">lyric poets</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:6" default="NO">1, 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:71" default="NO">8, 6, 71</bibl>; 10, 1, 96; 61 (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 55</bibl>, written in Gr. letters, <foreign lang="greek">lurikoi/</foreign>).</sense></entryFree>
lyristes: <entryFree id="n27396" type="greek" key="ly^ristes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lyristes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">luristh/s</foreign>, <sense id="n27396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a luteplayer, lyrist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">audisses lectorem, vel lyristen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 17, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 36, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lyrnesus: <entryFree id="n27397" type="main" key="Lyrne_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lyrnēsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Lyrnessus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lurnhso/s</foreign>, <sense id="n27397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Troas, the birthplace of Briseis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 32, § 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lyrnessi domus alta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:547" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 547</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27397.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lyrnēsĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Lyrnessius</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Lyrnesian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 108</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 176</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27397.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lyrnēsis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Lyr-nessis</orth>), <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos> (only used as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">the Lyrnesian</hi> (sc. <hi rend="ital">maid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">woman</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">abductā Lyrnesside tristis Achilles,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Briseis</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:15" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audierat, Lyrnessi, tuos, abducta, dolores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 403</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
lyron: <entryFree id="n27398" type="greek" key="lyron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lyron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lu/ron</foreign>, <sense id="n27398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, also called</hi> alisma, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 10, 77, § 124</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lysander: <entryFree id="n27399" type="main" key="Ly^sander"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lysander</orth>, <itype>dri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lu/sandros</foreign>. <sense id="n27399.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated Spartan general, conqueror of the Athenians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:22:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 22, 76</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 30, 109</bibl>; Nep. Lys.—</sense><sense id="n27399.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An ephor in Sparta, banished for injustice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 23, 80</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lysas: <entryFree id="n27400" type="gloss" key="lysas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lysas</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n27400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, also called</hi> artemisia, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lysiacus: <entryFree id="n27401" type="main" key="Ly^si^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lysĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Lysias, I. B.</entryFree>
lysiades: <entryFree id="n27402" type="main" key="Ly^si^a^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lysĭădes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lusia/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n27402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Athenian, son of the philosopher Phædrus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 5, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lysias: <entryFree id="n27403" type="main" key="Ly^si^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lysĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lusi/as</foreign>. <sense id="n27403.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Cephalus, a famous orator of Athens</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum fuit Lysias, quem jam prope audeas oratorem perfectum dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:9:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 9, 35</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 85, 293</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:54:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 54, 231</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 9, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:78" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:24" default="NO">12, 10, 24</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27403.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lysĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the orator Lysias</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gracilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27403.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A physician</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27403.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated sculptor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lysimachia: <entryFree id="n27404" type="greek" key="lysi^ma^chi^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lysĭmăchĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lusimaxi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n27404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, Lysimachia vulgaris, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 12, 82, § 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:141" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 14, 87, § 141</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27405" type="main" key="Ly_si^ma^chi_a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lȳsĭmăchīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lȳsĭmă-chēa</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lusima/xeia</foreign>, <sense id="n27405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Thrace</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Examili</hi>, Mela, 2, 2, 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:34:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 34, 6 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lȳsĭmăchĭ-enses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Lysimachians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:38:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 38, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lysimachos: <entryFree id="n27406" type="greek" key="ly_si^ma^chos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lȳsĭmăchos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lusi/maxos</foreign>, <sense id="n27406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone with golden veins</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 62, § 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lysimachus: <entryFree id="n27407" type="main" key="Ly_si^ma^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lȳsĭmăchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lusi/maxos</foreign>, <sense id="n27407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the generals of Alexander the Great, afterwards king of Thrace, and founder of Lysimachia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:43:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 43, 102</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 40, 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 61, § 143</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 17, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27407.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Acarnanian, instructor of Alexander the Great</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 15, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27407.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The discoverer of the herb lysimachia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 7, 35, § 72</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n27407.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lysinoe: <entryFree id="n27408" type="main" key="Ly^si^no^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lysĭnŏē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lusino/h</foreign>, <sense id="n27408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Pisidia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lysippus: <entryFree id="n27409" type="main" key="Ly_sippus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lȳsippus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lu/sippos</foreign>, <sense id="n27409.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated brass-founder of Sicyon, to whom alone Alexander the Great gave permission to cast a statue of him</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:86:296" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 86, 296</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 240</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 37, 38, § 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:37" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 7, 17, § 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lysis: <entryFree id="n27410" type="greek" key="ly^sis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lysis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lu/sis</foreign>. <sense id="n27410.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A loosening, rupture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trabes frangunt suā lysi structuras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27410.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A talon, ogee</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 6, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27411" type="main" key="Ly_sis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lȳsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small river in Asia Minor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 15, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27412" type="main" key="Ly^sis3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lysis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lu/sis</foreign>, <sense id="n27412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Pythagorean of Tarentum, instructor of Epaminondas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:34:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 34, 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:44:155" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 44, 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Epam. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lysistratus: <entryFree id="n27413" type="main" key="Ly_sistra^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lȳsistrătus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the brother of Lysippus, who first made statues of gypsum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:153" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 12, 44, § 153</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lysiteles: <entryFree id="n27414" type="main" key="Ly_si^te^le_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lȳsĭtĕlēs</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27414.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lyson: <entryFree id="n27415" type="main" key="Ly_son"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lȳson</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*lu/swn</foreign>, <sense id="n27415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated sculptor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lystra: <entryFree id="n27416" type="main" key="Lystra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Lystra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, or <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n27416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Lycaonia, north-west of Iconium</hi>, Vulg. Act. <cb n="MACA" /> 14, 8; 14, 21.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lystrēni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Lystra, Lystrenes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 42, § 147</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lytra: <entryFree id="n27417" type="main" key="lytra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lytra</orth>, v. lutra.</entryFree>
lytrotes: <entryFree id="n27418" type="greek" key="lytro_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lytrōtes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lutrwth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n27418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the æons of Valentinus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
lytrum: <entryFree id="n27419" type="spur" key="lytrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lytrum</orth>, false read. for lustra; v. 2. lustrum, II. E.</entryFree>
lytta: <entryFree id="n27420" type="greek" key="lytta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">lytta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">lu/tta</foreign>, <sense id="n27420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a worm under a dog's tongue, said to cause madness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 5, 32, § 100</bibl>. <cb n="M." /></sense></entryFree>
m: <entryFree id="n27421" type="main" key="M"><orth extent="full" lang="la">M</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">m</orth>, <itype>the twelfth letter of the Latin alphabet</itype> (J not being distinguished from I in the class. period), corresponds in form and sound to the Greek M; the Latin language, however, does not combine an initial <sense id="n27421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">m</hi> with <hi rend="ital">n</hi>, as in the Greek <foreign lang="greek">mna=, mnh=ma, mni/on, mno/os</foreign>, etc.; hence, the Greek <foreign lang="greek">mna=</foreign> became Latin mĭna. The Latin language, unlike the Greek, tolerated a final <hi rend="ital">m;</hi> but its sound was obscure, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 555</bibl> P. (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 31</bibl>), and before an initial vowel, even in prose, was scarcely heard (hence Verrius Flaccus proposed to represent it by an M half obliterated, thus, N). In poetry, the vowel also immediately preceding the <hi rend="ital">m</hi> was elided, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:34" default="NO">11, 3, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:109" default="NO">109</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 488</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 555 sq.</bibl> ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0996,001:1392" default="NO"><author>Val. Prob.</author> 1392</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0996,001:1440" default="NO">1440</bibl> ib. To this rejection of the <hi rend="ital">m</hi> at the end of words before vowels are owing the forms attinge, dice, ostende, facie, recipie, for attingam, dicam, ostendam, faciam, recipiam; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> the letter <ref targOrder="U">E</ref></xr>; and the forms donec for donicum, coëo, coërceo for com-eo, com-erceo; circueo, circuitus, for circum-eo, circum-itus; veneo for venum eo; vendo for venum do; animadverto for animum adverto, etc.—<hi rend="ital">M</hi> is substituted for <hi rend="ital">p</hi> or <hi rend="ital">b</hi> before a nasal suffix, as som-nus, cf. sopor, sopio; scamnum, cf. scabellum; Samnium for Sabinium; summus, cf. sub, super. Often also for <hi rend="ital">n</hi> before a labial, as impello for inpello; cf. rumpo, root rup-; lambo, root lab-, with fundo, root fud-, etc.—<hi rend="ital">M</hi> corresponds with the <hi rend="ital">m</hi> of all Indo-European tongues, like Gr. <foreign lang="greek">m</foreign>; cf. simul, <foreign lang="greek">a(/ma</foreign>; me, <foreign lang="greek">me</foreign>; mel, <foreign lang="greek">me/li</foreign>; magnus, <foreign lang="greek">me/gas</foreign>; but in inflections final <hi rend="ital">m</hi> corresponds with Gr. <foreign lang="greek">n</foreign>, as navem, <foreign lang="greek">nau=n</foreign>; musarum, <foreign lang="greek">mousw=n</foreign>; sim, <foreign lang="greek">ei)/hn</foreign>, etc.—<hi rend="ital">M</hi> is interchanged most freq. with <hi rend="ital">n;</hi> so eundem, eandem, quendam, quorundam, tantundem, from eum, eam, quem, quorum, tantum; and, on the other hand, <hi rend="ital">im</hi> is written for <hi rend="ital">in</hi> before labials and <hi rend="ital">m</hi>: imbellis, imbibo, imbuo; impar, impedio, imprimo, immanis, immergo, immuto, etc. Thus also <hi rend="ital">m</hi> regularly stands for the final <foreign lang="greek">n</foreign> of neuters borrowed from the Greek. A collat. form of Nilus, Melo, for <foreign lang="greek">*nei=los</foreign>, is mentioned in Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=7" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:18" default="NO">18</bibl> and 129 Müll.—The Latin <hi rend="ital">m</hi> also interchanges with Gr. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>: mel-ior, <foreign lang="greek">bel-ti/wn</foreign>; mortuus (Sanscr. mrita), <foreign lang="greek">broto/s</foreign> (v. for full details, Corss. Ausspr. 1, pp. 263 sqq.).As an abbreviation, M. denotes most freq. the prænomen Marcus, and less freq. magister, monumentum, municipium; v. the Index Notar. in <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2, p. 464 sq.</bibl> M' denotes the prænomen Manius.As a numeral, M, standing for CIC, denotes the number 1000.</sense></entryFree>
macae: <entryFree id="n27422" type="main" key="Macae1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Macae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in the north-eastern part of Arabia Felix</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Peri. 887</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27423" type="main" key="Macae2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Macae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">oi( *ma/kai</foreign> (Herod. 4, 175), <sense id="n27423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Africa in the</hi> regio Syrtica, Mela, 3, 8, 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 5, 5, § 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:275" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 275</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:670" default="NO">15, 670</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maces</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:222" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 222</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> Macen, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:60" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
macaerinthe: <entryFree id="n27424" type="greek" key="macaerinthe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">macaerinthē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">ma/kaira</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n27424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">another name for</hi> rosmarinus: <cit><quote lang="la">rosmarinum prophetae macaerinthen, Latini salutarem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 79</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
macareus: <entryFree id="n27425" type="main" key="Ma^ca^reus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Măcăreus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">trisyl.</orth>), <itype>ĕi and ĕos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*makareu/s</foreign>. <sense id="n27425.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Æolus, who lived in incest with his sister Canace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:564" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 564</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 242" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 242</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27425.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Măcărēïs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*makarhi+/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Macareus, Isse; acc. Græc.</hi>, Macarēïda, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 124</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27425.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A companion of Ulysses before Troy, and afterwards of Æneas in Italy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 159</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">441</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">voc. Græc.</hi>, <cb n="MACE" /> Macareu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 318</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27425.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Centaur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 452</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
macariotes: <entryFree id="n27426" type="greek" key="ma^ca^ri^o^te_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măcărĭŏtēs</orth>, <itype>ētis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">makario/ths</foreign> (happiness), <sense id="n27426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the æons of Valentinus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
macatus: <entryFree id="n27427" type="main" key="Maca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Macātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Livius Macatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
maccis: <entryFree id="n27428" type="main" key="maccis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maccis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n27428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fictitious spice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 43</bibl> (al. macis).</sense></entryFree>
maccius: <entryFree id="n27429" type="main" key="Maccius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Maccius</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n27429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">name of a Roman</hi> gens. —Hence, T. Maccius Plautus, <hi rend="ital">the celebrated Roman comic poet;</hi> v. Plautus.</sense></entryFree>
maccus: <entryFree id="n27430" type="main" key="maccus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maccus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cf. Sanscr. mūkas, dumb; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">mw=kos</foreign>, mockery; also <foreign lang="greek">*mw=mos</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n27430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a buffoon, punchinello, macaroni</hi>, in the Atellane plays: <cit><quote lang="la">in Atellana Oscae personae inducuntur, ut maccus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 488</bibl></cit> P.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2621</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27430.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a simpleton, blockhead</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">macci et buccones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 325, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
macedae: <entryFree id="n27431" type="main" key="Ma^ce^dae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Măcĕdae</orth>, v. Macetae.</entryFree>
macedo: <entryFree id="n27432" type="main" key="Ma^ce^do1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Măcĕdo</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, v. Macedones.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27433" type="main" key="Ma^ce^do2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Măcĕdo</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a usurer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:6:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 6, 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Măcĕ-dŏnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., relating to the usurer Macedo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatusconsultum,</quote> <trans><tr>a decree forbidding usurers to recover loans from heirs after they inherited their estates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:6:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27433.1" n="II" level="1"> Also <hi rend="ital">the name of a phitosopher, a friend of Gellius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:8:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 8, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
macedones: <entryFree id="n27434" type="main" key="Ma^ce^do^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Măcĕdŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype> (<sense id="n27434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Gr. acc.</hi> Macedonas, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 32, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 24, 5</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:6:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:8:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 8, 5</bibl>; v. Neue, Formenl. 1, 328), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*makedo/nes</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the Macedonians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:22:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 22, 76</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 25, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:33" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 33</bibl> sq. et saep.—Hyrcani Macedones, v. Hyrcani.— In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Măcĕdo</orth> (Macedon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:694" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 694</bibl>), <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Macedonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid Macedo Alexander?</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Alexander the Great</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:17:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 17, 48</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:694" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 694</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diffidit urbium Portas vir Macedo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Philip of Macedon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:19:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 19, 14</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n27434.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Macedonum robur,</quote> <trans><tr>a body of men armed in the Macedonian manner in the army of Antiochus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 18, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes">4</bibl> and 5.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27434.2" n="II" level="1"> </sense><sense id="n27434.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Măcĕdŏnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*makedoni/a</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Macedonia, Macedon, a country between Thessaly and Thrace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:3:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:4" default="NO">2, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:Agr. 1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. Agr. 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:33" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:6:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 6, 5</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n27434.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Măcĕdŏnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Macedonia, Macedonic, Macedonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 25, 30, § 104</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Măcĕdŏnĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a surname of Q. Cæcilius Metellus, who made Macedonia a Roman province</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:11" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 44, 45, § 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1:12" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27434.5" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Măcĕdŏ-nĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Macedonian</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27434.6" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Măcē^dŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*makedo/nios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Macedonian</hi>: Macedonia sarissa (with sec. syl. long, acc. to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*makhdo/nios</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:466" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 466</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">militi Macedonio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
macedonianus: <entryFree id="n27435" type="main" key="Ma^ce^do^ni^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Măcĕdŏnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Macedo, I.</entryFree>
macella: <entryFree id="n27436" type="main" key="Macella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Macella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ma/kella</foreign>, <sense id="n27436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Sicily, on the Crimisus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
macellarius: <entryFree id="n27437" type="main" key="ma^cella_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măcellārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>macellum</etym>, <sense id="n27437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the meat-market</hi> or <hi rend="ital">provision-market</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">taberna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:4:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotiator artis macellariae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 647, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ARS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4302</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27437.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">măcellārĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a meat-seller, victualler</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vendere apros macellario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:4:2" default="NO">3, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">macellarios adjuvare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
macellinus: <entryFree id="n27438" type="main" key="Ma^celli_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Măcellīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an epithet of the emperor</hi> M. Opilius Macrinus, <hi rend="ital">who killed his slaves in his own house</hi>, Capit. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
macellum: <entryFree id="n27439" type="main" key="ma^cellum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măcellum</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">măcellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:96:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 96, 9</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root <foreign lang="greek">max-</foreign>; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ma/xomai</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to fight;</hi> cf. <foreign lang="greek">ma/xaira, ma/xh</foreign>, and mactāre; prop. butcher's stall, shambles; hence, transf.</etym>, <sense id="n27439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">meat-market, provision-market</hi> (where flesh, fish, and vegetables were sold). </sense><sense id="n27439.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">venio ad macellum, rogito pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud emporium atque in macello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 4, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostin' porticum apud macellum hac deorsum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 34</bibl></cit>: excandefacere annonam macelli,<pb n="1092" /> <cb n="MACE" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 16</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">putarem annonam in macello cariorem fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:27:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 27, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barathrum macelli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae est ista laus, quae possit e macello peti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:15:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 15, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispositis circa macellum custodibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetariorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:17:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ipsum introitum exspectare macelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:10" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retibus adsiduis penitus scrutante macello proxima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 95</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conturbator macellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:96:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 96, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fercula nullis ornata macellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:64" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 64</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n27439.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">meat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcessitur inde macellum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 370</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
macellus: <entryFree id="n27440" type="hapax" key="ma^cellus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măcellus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n27440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [1. macer; cf.: ut in his macer, macriculus, macellus; <cit><quote lang="la">niger, nigriculus, nigellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:section=79" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, § 79</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. Paul. ex Fest. s. v. altellus, p. 7 Müll.], <hi rend="ital">rather meagre</hi>: homo, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 136, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27441" type="main" key="ma^cellus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măcellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. macellum <sense id="n27441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
maceo: <entryFree id="n27442" type="hapax" key="ma^ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măcĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>1. macer</etym>, <sense id="n27442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be lean, meagre</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia ossa atque pellis totust: ita cura macet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 509, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
macer: <entryFree id="n27443" type="main" key="ma^cer1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măcer</orth>, <itype>cra, crum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. root mak, to crush; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ma/ssw</foreign>, knead; <foreign lang="greek">mageu/s</foreign>, baker; Germ. mager</etym>, <sense id="n27443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lean, meagre</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27443.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of living beings (most freq. of animals): <cit><quote lang="la">taurus, opp. pinguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:146" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 146</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">turdi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mustela,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostreae inuberes et macrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 58</bibl>.—Of parts of the body: <cit><quote lang="la">in macerrimis corporis partibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 78:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 78, 8</bibl></cit>.—Humorously of a person: <cit><quote lang="la">valeat res ludicra si me Palma negata macrum donata reducit opimum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec pharetris Veneris macer est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:138" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 138</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n27443.2" n="B" level="2"> Of inanimate things, <hi rend="ital">thin, poor, barren</hi>: solum exile et macrum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:5:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 5, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager macrior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:24:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">macerrimi agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirpes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libellus,</quote> <trans><tr>meagre, thin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:6:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut dignus venias hederis et imagine macra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:29" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27444" type="main" key="Ma^cer2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Măcer</orth>, <itype>cri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27444.1" n="1" level="3"> C. Licinius Macer, <hi rend="ital">an historian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:2:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:67:238" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 67, 238</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 7, 12</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n27444.2" n="2" level="3"> Aemilius Macer, <hi rend="ital">a poet and a friend of Virgil and Ovid</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:44" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 44</bibl>; v. Aemilius.</sense></entryFree>
maceratio: <entryFree id="n27445" type="main" key="ma_ce^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mācĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>macero</etym>, <sense id="n27445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a steeping, soaking, maceration</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diuturna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27445.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A making soft</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tender</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 152</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maceresco: <entryFree id="n27446" type="hapax" key="ma_ceresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">māceresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n27446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to make soft</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tender</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 92</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maceria: <entryFree id="n27447" type="main" key="ma_ce^ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mācĕrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (post-class. form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mācĕ-rĭes</orth>, only <case>nom.</case> and <case>acc.</case>, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 138</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Hamart. 227</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 611, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4057</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>from macero, to soften; orig. a wall built of soft clay; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ma/ssw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n27447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an enclosure, a wall</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">maceriam sine calce ex caementis et silice altam pedes quinque facito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:14:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 14, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:5:12" default="NO">3, 5, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid maceria illa ait in horto, quaest quae in noctes singulas latere fit minor?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc in horto maceriam jube dirui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba in maceriis nascens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 19, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla maceria, nulla casa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: post villarum macerias, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 141, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossam et maceriam sex in altitudinem pedum praeduxerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maceria ab laeva semitae paulum exstans a fundamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27447.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Affliction</hi>: facere illi satis vis, quanta illius mors sit maceries tibi? Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 138, 13</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 150 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
maceriatio: <entryFree id="n27448" type="gloss" key="ma_ce^ri^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mācĕrĭātĭo</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">qrigkwsis</foreign> (<sense id="n27448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an enclosing</hi>), Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
maceriatus: <entryFree id="n27449" type="gloss" key="ma_ce^ri^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mācĕrĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>maceria</etym>, <sense id="n27449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">enclosed, walled in</hi>: SEPVLCRVM, Inscr Mur 1644, 14.</sense></entryFree>
maceries: <entryFree id="n27450" type="main" key="ma^ce^ri^es1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măcĕrĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <sense id="n27450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [1. macer], <hi rend="ital">distress, affliction</hi> (ante-class.), Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 138, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27451" type="main" key="ma_ce^ri^es2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mācĕrĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, v. maceria <sense id="n27451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
maceriola: <entryFree id="n27452" type="greek" key="ma_ce^ri^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mācĕrĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>maceria</etym>, <sense id="n27452.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small enclosure, wall</hi>, Inscr. Mur. 492, 2.</sense></entryFree>
macero: <entryFree id="n27453" type="main" key="ma_ce^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mācĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>prob. from root <foreign lang="greek">mag-, ma/ssw</foreign>, to knead; through an <pos>adj.</pos> mācerus; v. Corss. Ausspr. 1, 395; cf. also măcer</etym>, <sense id="n27453.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make soft</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tender, to soften by steeping, to soak, steep, macerate</hi> (not in <cb n="MACH" /> Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n27453.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">brassicam in aquam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salsamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in piscina lupinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen lacte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ramos genistae) marinā aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 9, 40, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(siliginem) novem diebus maceratum ... subigunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 11, 27, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grana (cacaliae) in oleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 11, 85, § 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intestina piscium sale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 7, 43, § 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">podagrici crura macerantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 18, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27453.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to weaken</hi> in body or mind, <hi rend="ital">to waste away, enervate</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27453.3" n="A" level="2"> Of the body: <cit><quote lang="la">multos iste morbus homines macerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam lentis macerer ignibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 13, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Macedo siti maceratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:13:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 13, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars exercitus ad utilitatem nostram macerata perductaque ad exitiabilem famem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:112:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 112, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fabius sic maceravit Hannibalem, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Hannibal's army</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:28" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muscus crura vitium situ et veterno macerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:22:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 22, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor solum viscerum vitiis non maceratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 69, § 182</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27453.4" n="B" level="2"> Of the mind, <hi rend="ital">to fret, vex, torment, distress, torture, pain</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">crucio, torqueo): egemet me concoquo et macero et defatigo,</quote> <trans><tr>fret myself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quor me excrucio? quor me macero? quor meam senectutem sollicito?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 3, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 107</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">noli te macerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura satis me lacrumis maceravi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc me facinus miserum macerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: infelix sollicitudo persequitur nec oratorem macerat et coquit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:77" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vos macerent desiderio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:54:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 54, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 13, 8</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with a causal <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consimili ratione ab eodem saepe timore macerat invidia, ante oculos illum esse potentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 75</bibl></cit>.— Mid., <hi rend="ital">to vex, torment one's self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maceror interdum, quod sim tibi causa dolendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 125</bibl></cit>: unum hoc maceror et doleo tibi deesse, Terenti, C. Caes. ap. Suet. Vit. Ter. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: ex desiderio magis magisque maceror, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 182</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
macerones: <entryFree id="n27454" type="main" key="Ma^ce^ro_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Măcĕrōnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Iberia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 10, 11, § 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maces: <entryFree id="n27455" type="main" key="Ma^ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Măces</orth>, v. 2. Macae.</entryFree>
macesco: <entryFree id="n27456" type="main" key="ma^cesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măcesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n27456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [maceo], <hi rend="ital">to grow lean</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thin, to become meagre</hi> (anteand post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">(apes) propter laborem asperantur et macescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:55:1" default="NO">1, 55, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">constat, arva segetibus ejus (hordei) macescere,</quote> <trans><tr>become poor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feminis bubus demitur (cibus), quod macescentes melius concipere dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuo maerore maceror, Macesco, consenesco et tabesco miser,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
macetae: <entryFree id="n27457" type="main" key="Ma^ce^tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Măcĕtae</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Măcĕdae</orth>), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*make/tai</foreign>. <sense id="n27457.0" n="I" level="1"> (As a less usual form for <foreign lang="greek">*makedo/nes</foreign>,) <hi rend="ital">Macedonians</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Macetae locupletissimo imperio aucti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:3:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen. plur.</hi> Măcĕtūm. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:6:106" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 6, 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:5" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 647</bibl>; Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> 2, 279</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> de Clar. Urb. 2, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27457.1" n="II" level="1"> (Because Antiochus the Great was a descendant of Seleucus Nicator) = Syri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:878" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 878</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
machabaeus: <entryFree id="n27458" type="main" key="Machabaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Machabaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of Judas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 1, 2</bibl> et saep.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Machabaei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Maccabees</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 18, 36; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 7, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
machaera: <entryFree id="n27459" type="greek" key="ma^chaera1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măchaera</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ma/xaira</foreign>, <sense id="n27459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sword</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.): machaera atque hasta, Enn. ap Fest. s. v. redhostire, p. 270 Müll. (Trag. v. 212 Müll.): succincti corda machaeris, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 9, 678</bibl> (Ann. v. 392 ib.): <cit><quote lang="la">eia machaeras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 38</bibl></cit> (Ann. v. 585 ib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ni hebes machaera foret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:24" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 15</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">A weapon</hi>, in mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 85</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27460" type="main" key="Ma^chaera2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Măchaera</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an auctioneer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:9" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
machaerium: <entryFree id="n27461" type="spur" key="ma^chaeri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măchaerĭum</orth>, <itype>ii, a false reading for machaeris</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 2, 9</bibl>.</entryFree>
machaerophorus: <entryFree id="n27462" type="greek" key="ma^chaero^pho^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măchaerŏphŏrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">maxairofo/ros</foreign>, <sense id="n27462.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sword-wearer, a satellite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">machaerophoris centum sequentibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>soldiers armed in the Greek manner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
machaerophyllon: <entryFree id="n27463" type="greek" key="ma^chaero^phyllon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măchaerŏphyllon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">maxairo/fullon</foreign> (sword-leaf), <sense id="n27463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi> (al. macrophyllon). <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
machaon: <entryFree id="n27464" type="main" key="Ma^cha_on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Măchāon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*maxa/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n27464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Æsculapius, a famous surgeon of the Greeks</hi> <cb n="MACH" /> <hi rend="ital">before Troy</hi>, Cels. praef.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:61" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 263</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:4:7 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 4, 7 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n27464.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in <hi rend="ital">plur., surgeons, physicians</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tibi cum medicis? dimitte Machaonas omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:16:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 16, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27464.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ma-chāŏnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Machaon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the art of surgery</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27464.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Măchāŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Machaon, Machaonian, surgical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Machaoniā ope sanus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 546</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:4:114" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 4, 114</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
