machetum: <entryFree id="n27465" type="main" key="machetum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">machetum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n27465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of rose</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
machilla: <entryFree id="n27466" type="greek" key="ma_chilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">māchilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>machina</etym>, <sense id="n27466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little machine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">e machillā sustuli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 74, 13</bibl></cit> dub. (al. e machina illam sustuli).</sense></entryFree>
machimus: <entryFree id="n27467" type="greek" key="Machi^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Machĭmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ma/ximos</foreign>, <sense id="n27467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of one of Actæon's hounds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 181" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 181</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
machina: <entryFree id="n27468" type="greek" key="ma_chi^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">māchĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> = <foreign lang="greek">mhxanh/</foreign>, <sense id="n27468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a machine</hi>, i. e. any artificial contrivance for performing work, <hi rend="ital">an engine, fabric, frame, scaffolding, staging, easel, warlike engine, military machine</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n27468.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27468.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">moles et machina mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes illae columnae machinā appositā dejectae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:55:section=145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 55, § 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torquet nunc lapidem, nunc ingens machina tignum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trahuntque siccas machinae carinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27468.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., </sense><sense id="n27468.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A platform</hi> on which slaves were exposed for sale: <cit><quote lang="la">amicam de machinis emere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 2:8" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27468.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A painter's easel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 37, § 120</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27468.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A scaffold</hi> for building: <cit><quote lang="la">de machinā cadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:6:5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 13, 6, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 2, 8, § 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27468.7" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A military machine, warlike engine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">machinis omnium generum expugnare oppidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut haec in nostros fabricata est machina muros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arietaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27468.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a device, plan, contrivance;</hi> esp. <hi rend="ital">a trick, artifice, stratagem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at nunc disturba quas statuisti machinas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>abandon your schemes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totam hanc legem ad illius opes evertendas tamquam machinam comparari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:18:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 18, 50</bibl></cit>: omnes ad amplificandam orationem quasi machinae, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 44</bibl>: dolum aut machinam commoliar, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:29:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 29, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantas moveo machinas!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquam machinabor machinam, Unde aurum efficiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 54</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
machinalis: <entryFree id="n27469" type="main" key="ma_chi^na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">māchĭnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>machina</etym>, <sense id="n27469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to machines</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">scientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 37, 38, § 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa machinali pondere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 21, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
machinamen: <entryFree id="n27470" type="main" key="ma_chi^na_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">māchĭnāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>machinor</etym>, <sense id="n27470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a contrivance, device</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 9, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
machinamentum: <entryFree id="n27471" type="main" key="ma_chi^na_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">māchĭnāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a machine, engine; an instrument, organ</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.; not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n27471.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">machinamenta alia quatiendis muris portabant,</quote> <trans><tr>military engines</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspensum et nutans machinamentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil tam ignarum barbaris, quam machinamenta et astus oppugnationum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot genera machinamentorum ad extendendum femur,</quote> <trans><tr>surgical instruments</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulis articulis singula machinamenta, quibus extorqueantur, aptata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 24:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 24, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 20:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 20, 3</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n27471.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the organs of sense</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1, p. 9, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27471.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a trick, device, stratagem</hi> (post-class.): callida commeantium, Cod. Th. 6, 28, 6.</sense></entryFree>
machinarius: <entryFree id="n27472" type="main" key="ma_chi^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">māchĭnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>machina</etym>, <sense id="n27472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to machines, machine-</hi> (postclass.). </sense><sense id="n27472.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mola,</quote> <trans><tr>which is worked by an animal by means of a machine</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 194, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">asinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensor,</quote> <trans><tr>a surveyor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:6:7" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 11, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commentator,</quote> <trans><tr>a machinist, machine-builder</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27472.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">māchĭnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who works on a scaffold</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:31" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
machinatio: <entryFree id="n27473" type="main" key="ma_chi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">māchĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>machinor</etym>, <sense id="n27473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">artificial contrivance, mechanism, machinery</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n27473.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum machinatione quadam moveri aliquid videmus, ut sphaeram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:38:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 38, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">data est quibusdam bestiis machinatio quaedam, et sollertia,</quote> <trans><tr>power of contrivance, design</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 48, 123</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27473.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (abstr. pro concreto), <hi rend="ital">a machine, engine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantae altitudinis machinationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 30</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 17: navalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: tale machinationis<pb n="1093" /> <cb n="MACI" />  genus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27473.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a trick, device, machination, contrivance; artifice, fraud</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judex tamquam machinatione aliqua tum ad severitatem, tum ad remissionem animi est contorquendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:17:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 17, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolus malus est omnis calliditas, fallacia, machinatio ad circumveniendum, fallendum, decipiendum alterum adhibita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:3:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14" default="NO">14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per machinationem obligatus,</quote> <trans><tr>by artifice, by fraud</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:36" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 45, 1, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
machinator: <entryFree id="n27474" type="main" key="ma_chi^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">māchĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>machinor</etym>, <sense id="n27474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maker of machines, a machinist, an engineer, architect</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n27474.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of Archimedes: <cit><quote lang="la">inventor ac machinator bellicorum tormentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">machinatores, qui pegmata per se surgentia excogitant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistri et machinatores quibus ingenium et audacia erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus rerum omnium machinator fecit hominem,</quote> <trans><tr>maker, creator</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 11</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n27474.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a contriver, inventor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">harum omnium rerum machinatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium architectus et machinator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:45:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 45, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum omnium scelerum improbissimus machinator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctor et machinator accusationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 274, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
machinatrix: <entryFree id="n27475" type="hapax" key="ma_chi^na_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">māchĭnātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>machinator</etym>, <sense id="n27475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inventress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malorum facinorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 266" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 266</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
machinatus: <entryFree id="n27476" type="main" key="ma_chi^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">māchĭnātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>machinor</etym>, <sense id="n27476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a contrivance, artifice, device</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">suo machinatu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 321, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
machinor: <entryFree id="n27477" type="main" key="ma_chi^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">māchĭnor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n27477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [machina], <hi rend="ital">to contrive skilfully, to devise, design, frame, invent</hi> (class). </sense><sense id="n27477.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">incredibile est, quantā operā machinata natura sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:59:149" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 59, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui haec machinatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec duo musici machinati ad voluptatem sunt, versum atque cantum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:44:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 44, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod machiner inveniamque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:944" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 944</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n27477.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to contrive artfully, to scheme, plot</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">mhxana=sqai</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquam machinabor machinam, Unde aurum efficiam amanti erili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquam astutiam corde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 3, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 4, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud quiddam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimico exitum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 19, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi nefariam pestem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:26:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 26, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">necem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:51:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 51, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perniciem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pestem in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27477.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">adversus aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:3:1:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 3, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">māchĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in pass. signif.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (sol, luna, etc.) ni machinata versarentur,</quote> <trans><tr>skilfully arranged, adjusted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 1</bibl></cit>: cum machinato strepitu tonitruum, <hi rend="ital">artificial</hi>, Sall. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 9</bibl>, and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 180, 22</bibl> (Hist. 2, 23, 3 Dietsch); <cit><quote lang="la">App. de Mundo, p. 67: indicium a P. Autronio machinatum,</quote> <trans><tr>contrived, planned, devised</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 48:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 48, 7</bibl></cit>: regis cura machinata fames, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 792</bibl> P. (Hist. 3, 34 Dietsch).</sense></entryFree>
machinosus: <entryFree id="n27478" type="hapax" key="ma_chi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">māchĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27478.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">skilfully constructed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
machinula: <entryFree id="n27479" type="main" key="ma_chi^nu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">māchĭnŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27479.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little machine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 26, 458</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=107:3" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 107, 3</bibl>; p. 147, 2.</sense></entryFree>
machio: <entryFree id="n27480" type="gloss" key="ma_chi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">māchĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who works on a scaffold, a mason</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">machiones dicti a machinis, quibus insistunt propter altitudinem parietum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 8, 2</bibl></cit> (hence, Fr. macon; Engl. mason).</sense></entryFree>
machlyes: <entryFree id="n27481" type="main" key="Machly^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Machlyes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fabled people of Africa</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">supra Nasamonas confinesque illis Machlyas androgynos esse utriusque naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
machorones: <entryFree id="n27482" type="main" key="Ma^cho^ro_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Măchŏrōnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Pontus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 4, 4, § 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
macia: <entryFree id="n27483" type="main" key="maci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">macĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n27483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, called by the Greeks</hi> <foreign lang="greek">a)nagalli/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">pimpernel</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
macies: <entryFree id="n27484" type="main" key="ma^ci^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măcĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>maceo</etym>, <sense id="n27484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">leanness, thinness, meagreness</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n27484.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27484.2" n="A" level="2"> Of living beings and the parts of their bodies: <cit><quote lang="la">profectus est (ad bellum) Hirtius consul: at quā imbecillitate? quā macie?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:34:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 34, 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc maciem facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 7, 20, § 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reducere ad maciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 8, 30, § 46</bibl></cit>: equi macie corrupti, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus macie extabuit, Cic. poët. Tusc. 3, 12, 26: turpis macies decentes Occupet malas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 53</bibl></cit>: tenet ora profanae Foeda situ macies, <cb n="MACR" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 515</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">macies aegri veteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:16" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:101" default="NO">15, 101</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27484.3" n="B" level="2"> Of inanim, things: <cit><quote lang="la">macies soli,</quote> <trans><tr>poorness, barrenness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:4:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidosa aurosi pulveris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jejuna corticis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mart. 10, 21</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">corticis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 27, 42, § 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seges macie deficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:689" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 689</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27484.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of water, <hi rend="ital">diminution</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum, e. g. at the ebb,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 23</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n27484.5" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">meagreness, poverty</hi> of language, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 21, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
macilentus: <entryFree id="n27485" type="main" key="ma^ci^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măcĭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>macies</etym>, <sense id="n27485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lean, thin, meagre</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">macilento ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">macilentis malis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: macilenti, macie tenuati, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=125" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 125</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <trans><tr>poor, barren</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 10, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">macilentiores vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: macilentior equus, Pelagon. Vet. 13.</sense></entryFree>
macio: <entryFree id="n27486" type="main" key="ma^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măcĭo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make lean, thin</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">meagre, to reduce</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Caspii maris fauces mirum in modum maciantur imbribus, crescunt aestibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 15, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: macio <foreign lang="greek">diaknai/w</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
macir: <entryFree id="n27487" type="gloss" key="macir"><orth extent="full" lang="la">macir</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">ma/ker</foreign>, <sense id="n27487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of red spicy bark brought from India</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 8, 16, § 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
macis: <entryFree id="n27488" type="main" key="ma^cis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măcis</orth>, v. maccis.</entryFree>
maco: <entryFree id="n27489" type="main" key="ma^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măco</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cf. macellum</etym>, <sense id="n27489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to maul, beat, hack</hi>: namque nullum Pejus macit homonem quamde mare saevum, Naev. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=397" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 397</bibl> Müll. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nunc saepe boves lucae ferro male mactae Diffugiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1339</bibl></cit> Munro ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
macor: <entryFree id="n27490" type="hapax" key="ma^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măcor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>maceo</etym>, <sense id="n27490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">leanness, meagreness</hi> (ante-class. for macies): corpus meum tali maerore, aegrore, macore senet, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 137, 1</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 275 Rib.); cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 699</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
macra: <entryFree id="n27491" type="main" key="Ma_^cra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mā^cra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n27491.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Italy, between Liguria and Etruria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Magra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 7, § 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 32, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 41, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n27491.1" n="II" level="1"> Macra Cōmē, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*makra\ kw/mh</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a town in Locris, on the border of Thessaly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 13, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
macresco: <entryFree id="n27492" type="main" key="ma_^cresco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mā^cresco</orth>, <itype>crŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n27492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [1. macer], <hi rend="ital">to grow lean, meagre</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">algor eas et famis macrescere cogit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:5:3" default="NO">3, 5, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">macrescit pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:3:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">macrescunt animalia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: invidus alterius macrescit rebus opimis, <hi rend="ital">grows thin at, pines away at</hi>, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 57</bibl>: curionem agnum Plautus pro macro dixit, quasi cura macruisset, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. curionem, p. 60 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
macricampi: <entryFree id="n27493" type="main" key="Macri Campi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Macri Campi</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Campi Ma-cri</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2 praef" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2 praef.</bibl> § 6, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 18</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">*makroi\ *ka/mpoi</foreign>, <sense id="n27493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a region in</hi> Gallia Cispadana, <hi rend="ital">on the river</hi> Macra, <hi rend="ital">in the vicinity of Parma and Modena</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2 praef" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2 praef.</bibl> § 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:2:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 18, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 12, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
macria: <entryFree id="n27494" type="main" key="Macria"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Macria</orth>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n27494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small island near Eubœa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 88, 90, § 204</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
macriculus: <entryFree id="n27495" type="main" key="macri^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">macrĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n27495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [1. macer], <hi rend="ital">lean</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:40:section=79" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, 40, § 79</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
macrinus: <entryFree id="n27496" type="main" key="Ma_^cri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mā^crīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a man</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27496.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A friend of the poet Persius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:1" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n27496.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman emperor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Caes. 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
macris: <entryFree id="n27497" type="main" key="Ma_^cris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mā^cris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*makris</foreign>, <sense id="n27497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several islands</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27497.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">In the Ægean Sea, near Ionia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28" default="NO" valid="yes">28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29" default="NO" valid="yes">29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27497.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An ancient name of the island of Eubœa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 21, § 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27497.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of Chios</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 38, § 136</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n27497.4" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of Icarus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 23, § 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
macritas: <entryFree id="n27498" type="main" key="ma^cri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măcrĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. macer</etym>, <sense id="n27498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">leanness, poorness, thinness</hi> (post-Aug. and rare for macies): <cit><quote lang="la">arenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
macritudo: <entryFree id="n27499" type="hapax" key="ma_^cri^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mā^crĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27499.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">leanness, thinness, meagreness</hi> (for macies): <cit><quote lang="la">ossa atque pellis sum, miser macritudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 26</bibl></cit> Weise (1, 2, 32 Brix and Fleck., who read aegritudine; acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 136, 2</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
macrobii: <entryFree id="n27500" type="main" key="Macro^bi^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Macrŏbĭi</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Macrŏbĭoe</orth>, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:150" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 150</bibl>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*makro/bioi</foreign> (longlived). <sense id="n27500.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A people of Æthiopia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:9:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 30, 35, § 190</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 2, 2, § 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:13:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 13, 5</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n27500.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The inhabitants of Apollonia, in Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
macrobius: <entryFree id="n27501" type="main" key="Ma^cro^bi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Măcrŏbĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*makro/bios</foreign> (living long): Aurelius Macrobius Ambrosius Theodosius, <sense id="n27501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman grammarian at the end of the fourth century, author of a commentary on Cicero's</hi> Somnium Scipionis, <cb n="MACT" /> <hi rend="ital">and of a treatise entitled</hi> Convivia Saturna lia, cf. Jan. Proleg. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> p. 1 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
macrocephali: <entryFree id="n27502" type="main" key="Macro^ce^pha^li"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Macrŏcĕphăli</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*makro, ke/faloi</foreign> (i. e. <sense id="n27502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">people with great heads</hi>), <hi rend="ital">a people of Pontus</hi>, Mela, 1, 19, 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 4, 4, § 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
macrochera: <entryFree id="n27503" type="greek" key="macro^che_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">macrŏchēra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">makro/xeira</foreign>, <sense id="n27503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having long sleeves, long-sleeved</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 33, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
macrochir: <entryFree id="n27504" type="greek" key="Ma^cro^chi_r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Măcrŏchīr</orth>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*makro/xeir</foreign>, <sense id="n27504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Longhand</hi>, = Lat. Longimanus, <hi rend="ital">a surname of king Artaxerxes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,021:1:3 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Reg. 1, 3 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 8, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
macrocolum: <entryFree id="n27505" type="greek" key="ma^cro^co_lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măcrŏcōlum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">măcrŏcol-lum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">makro/kwlon</foreign>, <sense id="n27505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">large-sized paper, royal paper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 25, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 24, § 80</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
macrocremniimontes: <entryFree id="n27506" type="main" key="Macrocremnii montes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Macrocremnii montes</orth>, <sense id="n27506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chain of mountains near the Dniester</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
macrologia: <entryFree id="n27507" type="greek" key="macro^lo^gi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">macrŏlŏgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">makrologi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n27507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tediousness in speech</hi> (Lat. longiloquium), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:Gram. Com. in Donat. de Barb. 3:1, p. 293" default="NO"><author>Pomp.</author> Gram. Com. in Donat. de Barb. 3, 1, p. 293</bibl> Keil (as Greek, trans., longior quam oportet sermo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 53</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
macrones: <entryFree id="n27508" type="main" key="Ma_^cro_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mā^crōnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Macerones and Machorones.</entryFree>
mactabilis: <entryFree id="n27509" type="hapax" key="macta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mactābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>macto</etym>, <sense id="n27509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">deadly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plaga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:805" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 805</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mactatio: <entryFree id="n27510" type="main" key="macta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mactātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slaying, killing</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">innoxiorum animantium mactatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 213</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 19, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mactator: <entryFree id="n27511" type="hapax" key="macta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mactātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slayer, murderer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mactator senum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 1002" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 1002</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mactatus: <entryFree id="n27512" type="hapax" key="macta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mactātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27512.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slaying, killing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mactatu parentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 99</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
macte: <entryFree id="n27513" type="main" key="macte"><orth extent="full" lang="la">macte</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">macti</orth>, v. mactus.</entryFree>
mactea: <entryFree id="n27514" type="main" key="macte^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mactĕa</orth>, v. mattea.</entryFree>
macto: <entryFree id="n27515" type="main" key="macto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">macto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (old form of <sense id="n27515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> mactassint, Enn., Afran., and Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 342, 12 sq.</bibl>), <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>macto, kindr. to Sanscr. makh, mah; <hi rend="ital">intens.</hi> māmahyata, to slaughter, sacrifice; maha, victim; the ct in macto like vectum from veho; hence</etym>, </sense><sense id="n27515.1" n="I" level="1"> Within the religious sphere, <hi rend="ital">to offer, sacrifice, immolate</hi> any thing in honor of the gods: <cit><quote lang="la">ferctum Jovi moveto et mactato sic,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 134, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § 4: pultem dis mactat, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 341, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigras pecudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectas de more bidentes Cereri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 57</bibl></cit>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 114, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mactatus vitulus concidit propter aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 353</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manibus divis mactata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:759" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 759</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mactata veniet lenior hostia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:19:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 19, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mactata Polyxena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 448</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trecenti ex dediticiis hostiarum more mactati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vite caper morsa Bacchi mactandus ad aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suovetaurilia mactanda, Fronto de Fer. Als. 3 Mai.: se Orco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium legiones Telluri ac diis Manibus mactandas dabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ruptores pacis ultioni et gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27515.2" n="II" level="1"> Beyond the relig. sphere. </sense><sense id="n27515.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To present, reward, honor</hi> with any thing good or bad: Livius inde redit magno mactatu' triumpho, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 9, 641</bibl> (Ann. v. 302 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">eos ferunt laudibus et mactant honoribus,</quote> <trans><tr>heap honors on, extol</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:43:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 43, 67</bibl></cit> (also ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 342, 5</bibl>); <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 11, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27515.4" n="B" level="2"> Far more freq. in a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">to afflict, trouble, punish</hi> with any thing: illum di deaeque magno mactassint malo, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 342, 15</bibl> (Trag. v. 377 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0404,001:ib. 16" default="NO"><author>Afran.</author> ib. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 15, 36</bibl>; cf. without <case>abl.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:ib. 12" default="NO"><author>Pompon.</author> ib. 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dotatae mactant et malo et damno viros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 61</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mactare malo adficere significat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 342, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem infortunio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: faxo tali eum mactatum, atque hic est, infortunio, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:9:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 9, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes patriae aeternis suppliciis vivos mortuosque mactabis,</quote> <trans><tr>pursue, punish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 13, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">divisores omnium tribuum domi ipse suae crudelissima morte mactaret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Harusp. Resp. 20, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem summo supplicio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:35:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 35, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mactantur comminus uno exitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:500" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 500</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n27515.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To kill, slaughter, put to death</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic mactat Ladona, Pheretaque Demodocumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 413</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illigatas mollibus damas plagis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:50:24" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 50, 24</bibl></cit>: haec dextra Lernam taetra mactata excetra Pacavit, Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 9, 22.—</sense><sense id="n27515.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To magnify;</hi> trop, <hi rend="ital">to extol, glorify, honor;</hi> esp. <hi rend="ital">to glorify</hi> <pb n="1094" /> <cb n="MACU" /> <hi rend="ital">honor</hi> a deity with sacrifices, <hi rend="ital">to worship</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liberum patrem fanorum consecratione mactatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerorum extis deos manes mactare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 6, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27515.7" n="E" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to give splendor to</hi> a festival: lacte Latinas, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 11, 18.—</sense><sense id="n27515.8" n="F" level="1"> Aliquem or aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to overthrow, ruin, destroy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 22, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum ego furori nisi cessissem, in Catilinae busto vobis ducibus mactatus essem,</quote> <trans><tr>should have been sacrificed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfidos et ruptores pacis ultioni et gloriae mactandos,</quote> <trans><tr>to offer up, immolate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum videant jus civitatis illo supplicio esse mactatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:11:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 11, § 26</bibl></cit>: aut naves uram, aut castra mactabo, <hi rend="ital">to destroy</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 341, 18</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, sync. for mactatus: <cit><quote lang="la">boves mactae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1339</bibl></cit> (better referred to maco, q. v.).</sense></entryFree>
mactus: <entryFree id="n27516" type="main" key="mactus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root <foreign lang="greek">mak</foreign>, in <foreign lang="greek">ma/kar</foreign>, blessed; cf. <foreign lang="greek">makro/s</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n27516.0" n="I" level="1"> In relig. lang., of the gods, <hi rend="ital">glorified, worshipped, honored, adored</hi> (only in the <case>voc.</case> macte, and rarely in the <case>nom.</case>): <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter te bonas preces precor, uti sies volens propitius mihi liberisque meis, mactus hoc fercto. Jove pater, macte vino inferio esto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 134, 2</bibl></cit> and 3; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 132, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: mactus hoc vino inferio esto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 296</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">macte hoc porco piaculo immolando esto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 139 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">macte hisce suovitaurilibus lactentibus immolandis esto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 141, 3</bibl></cit> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">macte hac dape esto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 132</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27516.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, beyond the relig. sphere, with or without esto, as an exclamation of applause or congratulation: macte, macte virtute (esto), macti virtute este, etc.; and as a standing formula, macte, even with <case>acc.</case> (v. infra), Engl. <hi rend="ital">good luck! hail to thee!</hi> etc.; in responses, <hi rend="ital">bravo! well done! that's right! go on!</hi> tantumne ab re tua est oti tibi, ut etiam Oratorem legas? Macte virtute! <hi rend="ital">increase in, go on in</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:17:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 17, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">macte virtute esto sanguinolentis et ex acie redeuntibus dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">macte virtute esto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: macte novā virtute, puer; <cit><quote lang="la">sic itur ad astra!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:641" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 641</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">macte virtute diligentiāque esto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 40</bibl></cit>: macte virtute simulque his versibus esto, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 9, 641</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">macte animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:280" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 280</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">macte bonis animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">macte toris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">macte hac gloriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:46" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">macte uterque ingenti in rempublicam merito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">macte esto taedis, o Hymenaee, tuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:13:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">macti virtute milites Romani este,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:36:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 36, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">macti ingenio este,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 12, 9, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos macti virtute estote,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juberem macte virtute esse, si pro meā patriā ista virtus staret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12, 14</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">macte fortissimam et meo judicio beatissimam in ipsis malis civitatem!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:18:16" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 18, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27516.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">macte animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:6:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 6, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:37" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:495" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 2, 495</bibl>.—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">macte animo, juvenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:280" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 280</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27516.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Macte!</quote> <trans><tr>that's right! well done! good!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27517" type="main" key="mactus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> of maco, q. v., and cf. macto <sense id="n27517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
macula: <entryFree id="n27518" type="main" key="ma^cu^la1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>for malocula, malcula, <hi rend="ital">dim.;</hi> cf. Sanscr. mala, dirt</etym>, <sense id="n27518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a spot, mark, stain</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n27518.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27518.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 155</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(bos) maculis insignis et albo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with white spots</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maculis albis equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 9, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maculis auro squalentibus ardens (rex apum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 91</bibl></cit>: in ipsis quasi maculis (terra), ubi habitatur, <hi rend="ital">in those spots</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">small places</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parcit cognatis maculis similis fera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:160" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 160</bibl></cit>; cf. 5, 104.—</sense><sense id="n27518.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a mesh in a net, a hole</hi> in network or in a web: <cit><quote lang="la">rete grandibus maculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:11:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 11, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reticulum minutis maculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:11:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 11, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retia maculis distincta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 19</bibl></cit>. —Of the meshes of a spider's web, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 24, 28, § 81</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27518.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a spot, stain, blot, blemish, mole</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">maculari corpus maculis luridis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est corporis macula, naevus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:28:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 28, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maculas auferre de vestibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:821" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 821</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 13, 50, § 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in veste facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e veste abluere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 7, 23, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mederi maculis corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 19, 33, § 140</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lentigines ac maculas e facie tollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 2, 4, § 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27518.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (acc. to I. B.), <hi rend="ital">a</hi> <cb n="MADE" /> <hi rend="ital">blot, stain, stigma, blemish, fault</hi> in character: quem scis scire tuas omnes maculasque notasque, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 350, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inest amoris macula huic homini in pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam ego ex corpore exigam omnis maculas maerorum tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 61</bibl></cit>: vitium commune omnium est, Quod nimium ad rem in senecta attenti sumus: hanc maculam nos decet Effugere, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">delenda vobis est illa macula, Mithridatico bello suscepta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est hujus saeculi labes quaedam et macula, virtuti invidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae splendorem maculis aspergere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furtorum et flagitiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:46:section=121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 46, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in oratione nitida notabile humilius verbum et velut macula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:28" default="NO">8, 5, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne Claudiae genti eam inustam maculam vellent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurima sunt nitidis maculam haesuram figentia rebus,</quote> <trans><tr>enduring disgrace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:2" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27519" type="main" key="Ma^cu^la2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Măcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, e. g. of Q. Pompeius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 19, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maculatim: <entryFree id="n27520" type="main" key="ma^cu^la_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măcŭlātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. maculo <sense id="n27520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
maculatio: <entryFree id="n27521" type="main" key="ma^cu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măcŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>maculo</etym>, <sense id="n27521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a spotting; a spot, stain</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n27521.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cutem maculationibus convariare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 306, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27521.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: aliquā infamiae maculatione pollutus, <hi rend="ital">stain</hi>, Firm. Math. 3, 15, 3.</sense></entryFree>
maculo: <entryFree id="n27522" type="main" key="ma^cu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măcŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. macula</etym>, <sense id="n27522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make spotted, to spot, speckle, variegate</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27522.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27522.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <hi rend="ital">to stain, tinge, dye</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">telas maculare ostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:368" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 368</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et multo maculatum murice tigrim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:704" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 704</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27522.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to spot, stain, defile, pollute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maculari corpus maculis luridis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">terram tabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 29</bibl></cit>: dextra maculata cruore, Ov. de Nuce, 157.—</sense><sense id="n27522.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (acc. to I. B.), <hi rend="ital">to defile, dishonor, disgrace</hi>, etc. (freq. in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">rex ille optimi regis caede maculatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:25:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 25, 46</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">partus suos parricidio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemora nefario stupro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:31:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 31, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catonis splendorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:28:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 28, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuum maculavi crimine nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:851" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 851</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde metus maculat poenarum praemia vitae,</quote> <trans><tr>spoils</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsoleta quoque (verba) et maculantia ex sordidiore vulgi usu ponit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:7:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 7, 4</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">măcŭ-lātim</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., in a spotted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mottled fashion</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Gen. ad Lit. 5:10" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Gen. ad Lit. 5, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maculosus: <entryFree id="n27523" type="main" key="ma^cu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măcŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of spots, spotted, speckled, dappled, mottled, variegated</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27523.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27523.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">maculosae tegmine lyncis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 323</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:37:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 37, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 6, 5, § 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 9, 6, § 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corium,</quote> <trans><tr>variegated, striped</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27523.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">spotted, blotted, stained, defiled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis Pompeii non multa, eaque maculosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:29:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 29, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maculosae sanguine harenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:395" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 395</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora suffusas quod habet maculosa lituras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:1:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 1, 15</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n27523.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">defiled, polluted, filthy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatores,</quote> <trans><tr>in bad repute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maculosas commodat aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:40" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir omni dedecore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritia et libidine foedus ac maculosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 11" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nefas,</quote> <trans><tr>unnatural, abominable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 22</bibl></cit>.— * <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maculosiora quam nutricis pallium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:de Or. 3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> de Or. 3</bibl></cit> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
madarus: <entryFree id="n27524" type="main" key="Ma^da^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mădărus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">madaro)s</foreign> (bald), <sense id="n27524.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname jestingly given to</hi> C. Matius, <hi rend="ital">on account of his baldness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 2, 1</bibl>; cf. Calvena.</sense></entryFree>
madaura: <entryFree id="n27525" type="main" key="Madaura"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Madaura</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Madauri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Numidia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ayedrah</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 2:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
madaurensis: <entryFree id="n27526" type="main" key="Madaurensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Madaurensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <sense id="n27526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the city of Madaura</hi> (on the borders of Numidia and Gætulia, not the city mentioned in the preced. art.), <hi rend="ital">Madauran</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Appuleius Madaurensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 49" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 49</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Madaurensis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an inhabitant of Madaura</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 271, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
madefacio: <entryFree id="n27527" type="main" key="ma^de^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mădĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n27527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a.;</hi> in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mădĕfīo</orth>, <itype>factus, fĭĕri</itype> <etym>madeo, facio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to make wet, to wet, moisten, to soak, drench, water</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n27527.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">lanam aceto et nitro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 7, 25, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amarantus madefactus aquā revirescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21</bibl></cit>, <cb n="MADE" /> 8, 23, § <cit><quote lang="la">47: radix in vino madefacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 6, 15, § 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spongiam (opp. exprimere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne libelli madefierent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbuti sanguine gladii, vel madefacti potius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeciam madefactum iri sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:32:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 32, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 330</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caules,</quote> <trans><tr>to soak, steep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 6, 31, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram suo madefecit odore,</quote> <trans><tr>steeped</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 253</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">caris vellera sucis bis madefacta,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>dyed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:2:16" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 2, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27527.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to drench</hi> with wine, <hi rend="ital">to intoxicate, make drunk</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose): eo vos vostrosque adeo pantices madefacitis, quom ego sim hic siccus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo madefactus Iaccho, Col. poët. 10, 309: poculis amplioribus madefacit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">molli luxu madefacta (membra),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:18" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
madefacto: <entryFree id="n27528" type="main" key="ma^de^facto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mădĕfacto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>madefacio</etym>, <sense id="n27528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to wet, moisten, water, irrigate</hi> (post-class.): humum, Ven. Carm. 1, 21, 26.</sense></entryFree>
madefactus: <entryFree id="n27529" type="main" key="ma^de^factus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mădĕfactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from madefacio.</entryFree>
madefio: <entryFree id="n27530" type="main" key="ma^de^fi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mădĕfīo</orth>, <itype>factus, fieri</itype>, v. madefacio.</entryFree>
madena: <entryFree id="n27531" type="main" key="Madena"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Madena</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n27531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a district of Great Armenia, between the rivers Cyrus and Araxes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 8, 3</bibl>; Sex. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> Brev. 16 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
madens: <entryFree id="n27532" type="main" key="ma^dens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mădens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. madeo <sense id="n27532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
madeo: <entryFree id="n27533" type="main" key="ma^de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mădĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">mada/w</foreign>, to drip; cf. Sanscr. mad-, to be merry; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">masto/s</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">mesto/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n27533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be wet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">moist, to drip</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flow</hi> with any thing (class.). </sense><sense id="n27533.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27533.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">natabant pavimenta vino, madebant parietes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:41:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 41, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Persae unguento madent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 1, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurima fuso Sanguine terra madet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:690" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 690</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vere madent udo terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 429</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radix suco madet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 12, 14, § 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimis madent genae,</quote> <trans><tr>are moistened, bedewed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 378</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruore maduit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 389</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec umquam sanguine causidici maduerunt rostra pusilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:121" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 121</bibl></cit>: metu, <hi rend="ital">to sweat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">melt with fear</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 1, 48</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27533.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n27533.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be drenched</hi> with wine, <hi rend="ital">to be drunk, intoxicated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra vino madent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquid tibi videor madere?</quote> <bibl
