n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">madide madere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">festā luce madere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:29" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 29</bibl></cit>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardescit lingua, madet mens, Nant oculi (of a drunken man),</quote> <trans><tr>his senses fail</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:479" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 479</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27533.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To be softened by boiling, to be boiled, sodden</hi> (mostly in Plaut. and Verg.): <cit><quote lang="la">jam ergo haec madebunt, faxo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collyrae facite ut madeant et colyphia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, quamvis igni exiguo, properata maderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comedam, inquit, flebile nati sinciput Pharioque madentis aceto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:85" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 85</bibl></cit>; cf.: commadeo, madesco.—</sense><sense id="n27533.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be full of, to overflow with, to abound in</hi> any thing (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">madeant generoso pocula Baccho,</quote> <trans><tr>be filled up to the brim</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:5" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">madent fercula deliciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 4, 76: <cit><quote lang="la">Caecubae vites in Pomptinis paludibus madent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 4, 3, § 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arte madent simulacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:792" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 792</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam Socraticis madet Sermonibus,</quote> <trans><tr>is full of, familiar with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:21:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 21, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus Cecropia pectora voce madent,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>perfectly versed in the Greek language</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:69:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 69, 2</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mădens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n27533.7" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">wet, moist</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27533.8" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">madentes spongiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 45, 69, § 149</bibl></cit>: campi, <hi rend="ital">wet, marshy</hi> (corresp. to paludes), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis madens sanguine,</quote> <trans><tr>dripping</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nix sole madens,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>melting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 13, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umor sudoris per collum,</quote> <trans><tr>flowing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinis,</quote> <trans><tr>flowing, abundant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Auster,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>rainy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 71" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 71</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">bruma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:5:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Neptune</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:8:8" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lamiarum caede,</quote> <trans><tr>reeking with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:154" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 154</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27533.9" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">drunk, intoxicated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mersus vino et madens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 83" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 83</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">distentus ac madens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ille meri veteris per crura madentia torrens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:319" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 319</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27533.10" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">full, filled, imbued</hi> with something: jure madens, <hi rend="ital">full of</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">skilled in law</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:51:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 51, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intercutibus ipsi vitiis madentes,</quote> <trans><tr>full of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui felle nullo, melle multo mens madens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Prof. 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
madesco: <entryFree id="n27534" type="main" key="ma^desco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mădesco</orth>, <itype>dŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n27534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [madeo], <hi rend="ital">to become moist</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wet</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n27534.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">semiusta madescunt Robora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:697" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 697</bibl></cit>: tellus Nubibus assi <pb n="1095" /> <cb n="MAEA" /> duis pluvioque madescit ab austro, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multā terra madescit aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:198" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 6, 198</bibl></cit>: nec madescimus nisi umore, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 28</bibl>: spectare oportet, num tempora paulum madescant, <hi rend="ital">become moist</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">perspire</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus invito maduerunt sanguine dextrae,</quote> <trans><tr>have killed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:391" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 391</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nati maduere paterno Sanguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 149</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n27534.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to get drunk, become intoxicated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (Chrysippum) cotidie ferunt madescere solitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:de Fer. Als. 3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> de Fer. Als. 3</bibl></cit> Mai.—</sense><sense id="n27534.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to become soft</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne umore madescant ungulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:30" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:23" default="NO">11, 3, 23</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">id. poët. 10, 398: triticum madescit dulci aquā ligneis vasis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 17, § 76</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
madide: <entryFree id="n27535" type="main" key="ma^di^de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mădĭdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. madidus <sense id="n27535.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
madido: <entryFree id="n27536" type="main" key="ma^di^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mădĭdo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>madidus</etym>, <sense id="n27536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make wet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">moist, to wet, moisten</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n27536.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n27536.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">proluvie linerent et madidarent se suā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">madidari ex imbribus arva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">madidatae spongiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 210, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n27536.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to be wet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille novo madidantes nectare pennas concutit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 88</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27536.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to make drunk, intoxicate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mero multo madidari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injecisse madidatis vincula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
madidus: <entryFree id="n27537" type="main" key="ma^di^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mădĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>madeo</etym>, <sense id="n27537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">moist, wet, soaked, drenched</hi> (rare until after the Aug. per.). </sense><sense id="n27537.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27537.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: fasciculus epistolarum aquā madidus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 12, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 39, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">madidi myrrhā capilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">madidis Notus evolat alis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:264" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 264</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 219</bibl> Cort.: <cit><quote lang="la">genae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>bedewed with tears</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:660" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 660</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comae,</quote> <trans><tr>moistened with unguents</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 14, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fossae,</quote> <trans><tr>wet, abounding in water</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:6:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 6, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:554" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 554</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:44:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 44, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pluvius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:36:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 36, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ver,</quote> <trans><tr>rainy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:51" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 51</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n27537.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosas madidas divini roris et nectaris video,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 143</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n27537.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n27537.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Dyed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis cocco madida, vel murice tincta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:23:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 23, 5</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n27537.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Drunk, intoxicated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">madidus vino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciam ut sit madidus sobrius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum peteret matellam madidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:89:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 89, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:23:11" default="NO">9, 23, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum madidum, nihili incontinentem, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>a drunkard, sot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molli luxu madefacta meroque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:18" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>spent in drinking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:1:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tarentum,</quote> <trans><tr>full of drunkenness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:297" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 297</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n27537.7" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">soft, boiled soft, sodden, soaked</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">madidiora lenticula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 5, 21, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">madida quae mihi apposita in mensam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 3, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cicer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:42:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 42, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:48:12" default="NO">10, 48, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">siliginis offas accipere et madidae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:473" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 473</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabe jecur madidum,</quote> <trans><tr>putrid, corrupt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:621" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 621</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27537.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n27537.9" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Soft, weak</hi>: madida memoria, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 699</bibl> P. (Com. Rel. v. 31 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n27537.10" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Full of, filled with</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">Minervae artibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:40:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 40, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">madidi jocis libelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:14:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 14, 12</bibl></cit>.— Hence, * <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mădĭdē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">moistly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non vides me uti madide madeam?</quote> <trans><tr>how thoroughly soaked, drunk, I am</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
madon: <entryFree id="n27538" type="main" key="ma^don"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mădon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. mados.</entryFree>
mador: <entryFree id="n27539" type="main" key="ma^dor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mădor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>madeo</etym>, <sense id="n27539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">moisture, wetness</hi> (very rare; not in Cic. or Cæs.): ingens terror erat, ne ex latere nova munimenta madore infirmarentur, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 138, 6</bibl> (Hist. 3, 26): <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoad me urinae madore perluerent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 108, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides madore infirmi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 82 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
mados: <entryFree id="n27540" type="greek" key="ma^dos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mădos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">mădon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ma/dos</foreign>. <sense id="n27540.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of grape-vine, white grape</hi>, = vitis alba, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 16, § 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27540.1" n="II" level="1"> A reading in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 7, 37, § 75</bibl>, for mallon, q. v.</sense></entryFree>
maduateni: <entryFree id="n27541" type="main" key="Maduate_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Maduatēni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. Madytos.</entryFree>
madulsa: <entryFree id="n27542" type="hapax" key="ma^dulsa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mădulsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>madeo</etym>, <sense id="n27542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drunken man</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc probe abeo madulsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: madulsa, ebrius, a Graeco <foreign lang="greek">mada=n</foreign> deductum, vel quia madidus satis a vino, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=126:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 126, 5</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
madytos: <entryFree id="n27543" type="main" key="Madytos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Madytos</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Madytus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*maduto/s</foreign>, <sense id="n27543.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seaport town in the Thracian Chersonese</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Maitos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:38" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 38</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maduatēni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Madytos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maea: <entryFree id="n27544" type="main" key="maea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n27544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of sea-crab</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 31, 51, § 97</bibl>. <cb n="MAEL" /></sense></entryFree>
maeander: <entryFree id="n27545" type="main" key="Maeander"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Maeander</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Maeandros</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mae-andrus</orth>), <itype>dri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*maiandros</foreign>, <sense id="n27545.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river, proverbial for its winding course, which rises in Great Phrygia, flows between Lydia and Caria, and falls, near Miletus, into the Icarian Sea</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Mendere Su; nom.</hi> Maeander, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 13, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 104:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 104, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 85, 87, § 201</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:113" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 29, 31, § 113</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Eutr. 2, 266</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 999</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maeandros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 246</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">8, 162</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 9, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maeandrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:139" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 139</bibl></cit>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=136" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 136</bibl> Müll.; <case>acc.</case> Maeandrum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:13" default="NO" valid="yes">13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maeandron,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 208</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">more Maeandri,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with turnings and windings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27545.1" n="2" level="3"> Personified, acc. to the fable, <hi rend="ital">the father of Cyane, and grandfather of Caunus and Byblis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:450" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 450</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27545.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (from the windings of the Mæander), as an appellative, and hence also in the <number>plur.</number> </sense><sense id="n27545.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A crooked</hi> or <hi rend="ital">roundabout way, a turning, twisting, winding, meandering, maze</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quos tu Maeandros, quae deverticula flexionesque quaesisti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 22, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 1, 12</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 246</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 162</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:139" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 683" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 683</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in illis dialecticae gyris atque Maeandris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:8:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maeandros faciebat et gyros, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mĕandros,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 6, 142</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27545.4" n="2" level="3"> In embroidery, <hi rend="ital">a border wrought with many involutions</hi> or <hi rend="ital">windings</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">victori chlamydem auratam, quam plurima circum Purpura Maeandro duplici Meliboea cucurrit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 251</bibl></cit>; cf. Serv. in loc.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 140, 2</bibl>, and Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=136" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 136</bibl> Müll.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n27545.5" n="II" level="1"> </sense><sense id="n27545.6" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maeandrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*maia/ndrios</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n27545.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mæander, Mæandrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis Maeandrius,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Caunus, the grandson of Mæander</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 573</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27545.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the river Mæander, Mæandrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:32:35" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 32, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Honor. 635</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27545.9" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maeandrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Mæandrian</hi> (acc. to I. B. 2.): <cit><quote lang="la">fluxus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—* </sense><sense id="n27545.10" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maeandrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., full of curves like the Mæander, Mæandrian</hi>: facies Maeandrata et vermiculata, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 140, 5</bibl> (Sat. Men. 86, 14).</sense></entryFree>
maecenas: <entryFree id="n27546" type="main" key="Maece_nas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Maecēnas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Tuscan, perh. Maecnatial; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:40" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 40</bibl>; Müll. Etrusk. 1, p. 404; 415</etym>: C. Cilnius Maecenas, <sense id="n27546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman knight, descended, on the mother's side, from the Arretinian</hi> gens <hi rend="ital">of the</hi> Maecenates (and on the father's side from that of the Cilnii; <cit><quote lang="la">v. Müll. l. c. p. 416 sq.),</quote> <trans><tr>the friend of Augustus and the patron of Horace and Virgil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 8</bibl></cit> (9), 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:88:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 88, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 3:9 sq" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 3, 9 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 19:8 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 19, 8 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:114:4" default="NO">114, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27546.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, to denote, in gen., </sense><sense id="n27546.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A patron</hi> of literature: <cit><quote lang="la">sint Maecenates, non deerunt, Flacce, Marones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:56:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 56, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 3:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis tibi Maecenas erit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:94" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27546.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A person of distinction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestem Purpuream teneris quoque Maecenatibus aptam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:39" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 39</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n27546.4" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A luxurious, effeminate person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum referens de Maecenate supino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:66" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 66</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27546.5" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maecēnātĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mæcenas</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <trans><tr>named after him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
maecia: <entryFree id="n27547" type="main" key="Maeci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Maecĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Mētĭa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, v. 2. Maecius, II.</entryFree>
maecius: <entryFree id="n27548" type="main" key="Maeci^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Maecĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n27548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. So, Sp. Maecius Tarpa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:387" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 387</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 10</bibl>. 38 Orell. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27549" type="main" key="Maeci^us2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Maecĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Mētĭus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a place in Latium</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec procul ab Lanuvio (ad Maecium is locus dicitur) castra oppugnare est adortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 2, 8</bibl></cit> (dub.; Weissenb. ad Mecium).—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27549.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maecĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a tribe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 17, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:37" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 16, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 15, 9</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=136" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 136</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
maedi: <entryFree id="n27550" type="main" key="Maedi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Maedi</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Mēdi</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mai=doi</foreign>, <sense id="n27550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Thracian people on the borders of Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 1, 1, § 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 11, 18, § 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 25, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 5, 7</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27550.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mae-dĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Mēd-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*maidiko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Mædi.—Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maedĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. terra or regio), <hi rend="ital">the Mædian territory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:25:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 25, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:21" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22" default="NO" valid="yes">22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maeles: <entryFree id="n27551" type="main" key="maeles"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maeles</orth>, v. 1. meles.</entryFree>
maelianus: <entryFree id="n27552" type="main" key="Maeli^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Maelĭānus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Mēl-</orth>), v. Maelius.</entryFree>
maelium: <entryFree id="n27553" type="main" key="maeli^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maelĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. mellum.</entryFree>
maelius: <entryFree id="n27554" type="main" key="Maeli^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Maelĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n27554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens, <cb n="MAEO" /> <hi rend="ital">of which the most celebrated member is</hi> Sp. Maelius, <hi rend="ital">who, under suspicion of aiming at kingly power, was slain, at the command of the dictator L. Quinctius Cincinnatus, by the</hi> magister equitum <hi rend="ital">C. Servilius Ahala</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:13 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 13 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 16, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:44:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 44, 114</bibl>; cf. Aequimaelium.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27554.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maelĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mælius, Mælian</hi>: caedes, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the murder of</hi> Sp. Maelius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 16</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maelĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the partisans of Mælius, Mælians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maena: <entryFree id="n27555" type="greek" key="maena"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maena</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mēna</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mai/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n27555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of small sea-fish</hi>, eaten salted by the poor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 149</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:120" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:31:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 31, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:32:15" default="NO">12, 32, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:76" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acipenserem maenae non anteponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:28:91" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 28, 91</bibl></cit>.—As a term of reproach: <cit><quote lang="la">deglupta maena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
maenades: <entryFree id="n27556" type="main" key="Maena^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Maenădes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*maina/des</foreign> [Gr. <foreign lang="greek">mai/nomai</foreign>, to be inspired, rave], <sense id="n27556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the priestesses of Bacchus, Bacchantes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hederigerae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:69" default="NO" valid="yes">69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Threïciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:458" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 458</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ausoniae,</quote> <trans><tr>the Italian Bacchantes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:504" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 504</bibl></cit>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maenas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Bacchante</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 6</bibl> (4, 7), 14; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:102" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:105" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 105</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27556.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27556.2" n="A" level="2"> Maenades Priapi, <hi rend="ital">priestesses</hi> or <hi rend="ital">worshippers of Priapus, matrons who made invocations to Priapus in the temples of the</hi> Bona Dea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:315" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 315</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n27556.3" n="B" level="2"> In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maenas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an inspired prophetess;</hi> of Cassandra, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:11:64" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 11, 64</bibl> (4, 12, 62); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 718" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 718</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maenalus: <entryFree id="n27557" type="main" key="Maena^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Maenălus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mae-năla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mai/nalon</foreign>, <sense id="n27557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a range of mountains in Arcadia, extending from Megalopolis to Tegea, and sacred to Pan; nom.</hi> Maenalus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 6, 10, § 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maenalos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:89" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maenala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 216</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Maenalon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:415" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 415</bibl>; 442. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n27557.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maenălĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*maina/lios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mænalus, Mænalian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:719" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 719</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferae,</quote> <trans><tr>that dwell on the Mænalus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canis,</quote> <trans><tr>a hound bred there</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 272</bibl></cit>: pater, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Bacchus</hi> (whose orgies were celebrated on Mount Mænalus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:429" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 429</bibl>: ramus, <hi rend="ital">the club of Hercules</hi>, consisting of the branch of a tree broken off on this mountain, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 9, 15.—</sense><sense id="n27557.2" n="2" level="3"> Also transf. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <hi rend="ital">Arcadian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incipe Maenalios mecum, mea tibia, versus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>shepherd songs, such as were used in Arcadia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Pan</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:650" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 650</bibl></cit>: ales, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Mercury</hi>, who was born in Arcadia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:65" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 65</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27557.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maenălĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mainali/dhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the Mænalide</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Pan</hi>, to whom the Mænalus was sacred: <cit><quote lang="la">Maenalide Pan,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 12, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27557.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maenă-lis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mainali/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Mænalus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ursa,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Callisto</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:8" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Arcadia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 84</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
maenas: <entryFree id="n27558" type="main" key="Maenas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Maenas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. Maenades.</entryFree>
maenius: <entryFree id="n27559" type="main" key="Maeni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Maenĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n27559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Maenius, consul A. U. C. 416,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 13, 1</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27559.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maenĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Mænius, Mænian</hi>: Maenia lex, <hi rend="ital">proposed by the people's tribune Mænius</hi>, A. U. C. 468, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 14, 55</bibl>.— Esp. freq., <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maenĭa Cŏlumna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a pillar in the Forum, at which thieves and refractory slaves were scourged, and to which bad debtors were summoned, a whipping-post</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:16:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 16, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:58:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 58, 124</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27559.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maenĭānum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a projecting gallery, balcony</hi> of a house (first made use of by a Mænius); commonly used in the <number>plur.</number>: Maeniana appellata sunt a Maenio censore, qui primus in Foro ultra columnas tigna projecit, quo ampliarentur superiora spectacula, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=134" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 134</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 22, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 1, 2</bibl>; Varro ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 37, § 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:242" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 242</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 8, 10, 11</bibl>. —In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maenianum conscendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:12:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 12, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
maenomenon: <entryFree id="n27560" type="greek" key="maeno^me^non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maenŏmĕnon mel</orth>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">maino/menon me/li</foreign>, <sense id="n27560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of honey</hi> in Pontus, which was said to cause madness, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 13, 45, § 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maeon: <entryFree id="n27561" type="main" key="Maeon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Maeon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*maiw/n</foreign>. <sense id="n27561.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Theban, a priest of Apollo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:693" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 693</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 598</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27561.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Lydian;</hi> v. Maeones.</sense></entryFree>
maeones: <entryFree id="n27562" type="main" key="Maeo^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Maeŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mai/ones</foreign>, <sense id="n27562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Mæonia, Mæonians</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">Lydians</hi>,<pb n="1096" /> <cb n="MAER" />  in gen.: dicti post Maeona regem Maeones, Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 2, 256</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27562.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maeŏnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*maioni/a</foreign> (orig. the country of Mæonia, in Lydia).— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, </sense><sense id="n27562.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Lydia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 30, § 110</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n27562.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Etruria</hi>, because the Etruscans were said to be descended from the Lydians, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:499" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 499</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27562.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maeŏnĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*maioni/dhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a Mæonide, native of Mæonia (Lydia)</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27562.5" n="1" level="3"> A <usg type="style">poet.</usg> designation of <hi rend="ital">Homer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 9, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:10:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 10, 8</bibl> (cf. Milton, P. L. 3, 35).—</sense><sense id="n27562.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An Etrurian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:759" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 759</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maeonidūm tellus,</quote> <trans><tr>Etruria</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:607" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 607</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n27562.7" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maeŏnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*maioni/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a Mæonian woman, Lydian woman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maeonis elusam designat imagine tauri Europen,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Arachne</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maeonis aurato conspicienda sinu,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Omphale</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:310" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 310</bibl></cit>.—As <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">femina,</quote> <trans><tr>a Lydian woman</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 5, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27562.8" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maeŏ-nĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*maio/nios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mæonia, Lydian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:546" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 546</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Lydian wine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 380</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the Lydian river Mæander</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 252</bibl></cit>: rex, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Midas</hi>, Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> 1, 165</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maeŏnĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Lydians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 30, § 111</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n27562.9" n="b" level="4"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Mæonide</hi> (Homer), <hi rend="ital">Mæonidic, Homeric</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chartae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:12:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 373</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:527" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 527</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl> prooem. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> —</sense><sense id="n27562.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Etruria, Etrurian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maeonii nautae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 423</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus,</quote> <trans><tr>the Trasimene Lake</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:35" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <trans><tr>Etruria</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequor,</quote> <trans><tr>the plain surrounding Lake Trasimene</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:329" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 329</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
maeotae: <entryFree id="n27563" type="main" key="Maeo_tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Maeōtae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*maiw=tai</foreign>, <sense id="n27563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Scythian people on Lake Mæotis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 88</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27563.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maeōtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*maiwtiko/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Lake Mæotis, Mæotic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palus,</quote> <trans><tr>Lake Mæotis</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 67, 67, § 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glacies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:42" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 146</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mae-ōtĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the people living around Lake Mæotis</hi> (for Maeotae), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:17" default="NO">1, 19, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 7, 7, § 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27563.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maeōtĭ-dae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Mæotic tribes, dwellers around Lake Mæotis</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tac. 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27563.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maeōtis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype> (dos and is), <hi rend="ital">adj., f.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">*maiw=tis</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Mæotic</hi>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">Scythian, Tauric</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ora,</quote> <trans><tr>of Lake Mæotis</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:2:59" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiems,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Scythian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:12:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ara,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Tauric</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:115" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Penthesilea,</quote> <trans><tr>from the region about Lake Mæotis</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:10:14" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 10, 14</bibl></cit>.—Esp.: Palus Maeotis, <hi rend="ital">Lake Mæotis</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Sea of Azov</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 8, 10, § 23</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also: Lacus Maeotis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 12, 24, § 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 7, 6, § 18</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maeotis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 12, 24, § 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:84" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 12, 26, § 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 9, 9, § 47</bibl>: supra Maeoti' paludes, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:17:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 17, 49</bibl> (Epigr. v. 7 Vahl.).—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: Maeotides peltiferae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the Amazons, women dwelling on the Mæotis</hi>, Sabin. Ep. 2, 9.—</sense><sense id="n27563.4" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maeōtĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Mæotian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:799" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 799</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 349</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 24, § 76</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
maera: <entryFree id="n27564" type="main" key="Maera"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Maera</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mai=ra</foreign>. <sense id="n27564.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a woman who was changed into a dog</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:362" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 362</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 406</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">the name of a dog</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 131" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 131</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27564.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A priestess of Venus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:478" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 478</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maerens: <entryFree id="n27565" type="main" key="maerens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maerens</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">moer-</orth>), <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. maereo.</entryFree>
maereo: <entryFree id="n27566" type="main" key="maere^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maerĕo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">moer-</orth>), <itype>ēre</itype> (maerui, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 8, p. 817</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Carus, 1, 4</bibl>; <sense id="n27566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. gen. plur.</hi> maerentūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 216</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> collat. form dub., Matius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=95" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 95</bibl> Müll., where, for maerebar and mirabar of the MSS., Müller reads maerebat; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:39:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 39, 84</bibl>, where, for maerebamini, the best MSS. have maerebatis), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [root mis; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">mi=sos, mise/w</foreign>; Lat. miser; cf. moestus]. </sense><sense id="n27566.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to be sad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mournful, to mourn, grieve, lament</hi> (class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">doleo, lugeo, angor): cum immolanda Iphigenia tristis Calchas esset, maestior Ulixes, maereret Menelaüs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:22:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 22, 74</bibl></cit>: nemo maeret suo incommodo; <cit><quote lang="la">dolent fortasse et anguntur,</quote> <trans><tr>mourns over his own misfortune</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:13:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 13, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum omnes boni abditi inclusique maererent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos taciti maerebatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:39:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 39, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines alienis bonis maerentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:25:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 25, 56</bibl></cit>: qui (amici) tuo dolore maerent, Sulp. <cb n="MAES" /> ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maereat haec genero, maereat illa viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:2:14" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedatio maerendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:27:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 27, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellectumque nihil profici maerendo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § 64.— <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maeretur, fletur, lamentatur diebus plusculis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 157, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27566.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to mourn over, bemoan, lament, bewail</hi> any thing (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">filii mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:48:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 48, 115</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 44, 105</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem perditorum civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:17:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 17, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae calamitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casum ejusmodi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud maereo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talia maerens,</quote> <trans><tr>thus lamenting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:664" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 664</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27566.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. and inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui patriam nimium tarde concidere maererent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 11, 25</bibl></cit>: corpora Graiorum maerebat mandier igni, Matius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=95" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 95</bibl> Müll. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">maerens</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">moer-</orth>), <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., mourning, lamenting, mournful, sad</hi>: maerentes, flentes, lacrimantes, commiserantes, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 442</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 107 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">quis Sullam nisi maerentem, demissum, afflictumque vidit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:26:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 26, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc cum afflictum, debilitatum, maerentem viderem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:47:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 47, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc domo maerens ad rem publicam confugere possum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interque maerentes amicos Egregius properaret exsul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictis maerentia pectora mulcet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fletus maerens,</quote> <trans><tr>mournful lamentation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:13:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 13, 30</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: mater maerentissima, Inscr. Mur. 1229, 7.</sense></entryFree>
maereor: <entryFree id="n27567" type="main" key="maere^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maerĕor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">moer-</orth>), <itype>ēri</itype>, v. maereo <sense id="n27567.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
maeror: <entryFree id="n27568" type="main" key="maeror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maeror</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">moer-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>maereo</etym>, <sense id="n27568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mourning, sadness, grief, sorrow, lamentation</hi>, whether secret or open (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">maeror est aegritudo flebilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:8:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: maerorem minui; <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem nec potui, nec, si possem, vellem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 28, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:31:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 31, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maerore se conficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:12:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 12, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maeror funeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:47:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 47, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clausi in tenebris cum maerore et luctu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in maerore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacere in maerore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versari in maerore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maerore macerari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meus me maeror lacerat et conficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maerore consenui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maeroris tabe confecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 12, 12, § 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deponere maerorem atque luctum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 13, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a maerore recreari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetuo maerore senescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:245" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 245</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">meorum maerorum atque amorum summam edictavi tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pol maerores mi antevortunt gaudiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: mibi maerores (dabo), illi luctum, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:25:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 25, 65</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 309 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">accedunt aegritudines, molestiae, maerores, qui exedunt animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 18, 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
maesia: <entryFree id="n27569" type="main" key="Maesi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Maesĭa Silva</orth>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Messĭa Silva</orth>, <sense id="n27569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a forest in the territory of the Veii, on the borders of Etruria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Bosco di Baccano</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:33:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 33, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 58, 83, § 225</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maesius: <entryFree id="n27570" type="gloss" key="maesius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maesius</orth>, <itype>linguā Oscā, mensis Maius</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=136" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 136</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
maeson: <entryFree id="n27571" type="gloss" key="Maeson"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Maeson</orth>, <itype>persona comica ab inventore dicta</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=135" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 135</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
maeste: <entryFree id="n27572" type="main" key="maeste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maestē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">moestē</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. maestus <sense id="n27572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> * A.</sense></entryFree>
maestifico: <entryFree id="n27573" type="main" key="maesti^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maestĭfĭco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">moest-</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>maestus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n27573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make sad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sorrowful, to sadden</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">si paupertas angit, si luctus maestificat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 121" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies umbris maestificata larvalibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 13 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 888</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
maestificus: <entryFree id="n27574" type="main" key="maesti^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maestĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">saddening</hi> (eccl. Lat.) [Fulg.], Serm. 14.</sense></entryFree>
maestiter: <entryFree id="n27575" type="main" key="maesti^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maestĭter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">moest-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. maestus <sense id="n27575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
maestitia: <entryFree id="n27576" type="main" key="maesti^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maestĭtĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">moest-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>maestus</etym>, <sense id="n27576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a being sad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sorrowful, sadness, sorrow, grief, dejection, melancholy</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ex maestitiā, ex hilaritate, ex risu, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:146" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 41, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totis theatris maestitiam inferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in maestitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 15, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maestitiae resistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:43:148" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 43, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientia est una, quae maestitiam pellat ex animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:13:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 13, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa maestitia est, caruisse anno circensibus uno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:53" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 53</bibl></cit>.—Of inanim. things, <hi rend="ital">gloom, gloominess, severity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:16:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 16, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
maestitudo: <entryFree id="n27577" type="main" key="maesti^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maestĭtūdo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">moest-</orth>), <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sadness</hi> (ante- and post-class., for maestitia), Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 136, 24</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 616 <cb n="MAGI" /> Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">ego sum miser, cui tanta maestitu do obtigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; Cael. Aur Tard. 1, 4, 104; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Ep. 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">captivitatis maestitudinem (societate) consolari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> de Vid. 6, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
maesto: <entryFree id="n27578" type="hapax" key="maesto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maesto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">moest-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>maestus</etym>, <sense id="n27578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make sad, to grieve, afflict</hi>, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 137, 27</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 91 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
maestus: <entryFree id="n27579" type="main" key="maestus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">maestus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">moest-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>maereo, q. v.</etym>, <sense id="n27579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of sadness, sad, sorrowful, afflicted, dejected, melancholy</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n27579.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid vos maestos tam tristesque esse conspicor?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id misera maestast, sibi eorum evenisse inopiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:28:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 28, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum immolanda Iphigenia tristis Calchas esset, maestior Ulixes, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:22:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 22, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maestus ac sordidatus senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:47:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 47, 195</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maestus ac sollicitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maestissimus Hector,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 270</bibl></cit>.—Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">maesto et conturbato vultu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 15, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maesta ac lugentia castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 18, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maestam attonitamque videre urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:199" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maesta manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:454" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 454</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrida pro maestis lanietur pluma capillis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:854" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 854</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:5:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 202</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam maestam teneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10</bibl></cit>. 775.—</sense><sense id="n27579.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n27579.3" n="A" level="2"> Like tristis, <hi rend="ital">gloomy, severe</hi> by nature: <cit><quote lang="la">ille neci maestum mittit Oniten,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 514</bibl></cit> (naturaliter tristem, severum, quem Graeci <foreign lang="greek">skuqrwpo\n</foreign> dicunt <foreign lang="greek">a)ge/laston</foreign>, Serv.): <cit><quote lang="la">tacitā maestissimus irā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:568" default="NO"><author>Val.
