Fl.</author> 5, 568</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratores maesti et inculti,</quote> <trans><tr>gloomy</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27579.4" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">connected with mourning; containing, causing</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">showing sadness; sad, unhappy, unlucky</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <trans><tr>a mourning garment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 4</bibl></cit> (4, 5), 13: <cit><quote lang="la">tubae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 11, 9: <cit><quote lang="la">funera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:660" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 660</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa parentis Condidimus terrā maestasque sacravimus aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a laevā maesta volavit avis,</quote> <trans><tr>the bird of ill omen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:128" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 128</bibl></cit>: venter, <hi rend="ital">exhausted with hunger</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 350, 33</bibl> (enectus fame, Non.).—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in two forms. * </sense><sense id="n27579.5" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">maestē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with sadness, saaly, sorrowfully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maeste, hilariter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 14, 24</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n27579.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">maestĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a way to indicate sorrow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">maestiter vestitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
maevius: <entryFree id="n27580" type="main" key="Maevi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Maevĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maevĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n27580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Roman proper names.</hi> </sense><sense id="n27580.1" n="A" level="2"> Maevius. </sense><sense id="n27580.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A secretary of Verres</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:75:section=175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 75, § 175</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n27580.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A wretched poet, contemporary with Virgil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:10:2" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 10, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27580.4" n="B" level="2"> Maevia, <hi rend="ital">a woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:4:87" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 31, 4, 87</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27580.5" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Maevĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Mævius, Mævian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:5:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:76" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 31, 1, 76 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
maga: <entryFree id="n27581" type="main" key="ma^ga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. magus.</entryFree>
magaba: <entryFree id="n27582" type="hapax" key="Maga^ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Magăba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n27582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Galatia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
magalia: <entryFree id="n27583" type="foreign" key="ma_ga_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">māgālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Punic; Hebr. <foreign />; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">me/garon</foreign>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Or. 15, 12</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n27583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">little dwellings, huts, tents</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27583.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: magalia aedificia quasi cohortes rotundas dicunt, Cato, Orig. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 421</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">miratur molem Aeneas, magalia quondam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 421</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 259</bibl>; Serv. ad loc.; so Sall. and Cass. Hem. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 421</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27583.2" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Māgālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the suburbs of Carthage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 86</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 368</bibl> (al. Magaria).</sense></entryFree>
magdalia: <entryFree id="n27584" type="main" key="magda_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magdālĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n27584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cylindrical figures</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 37</bibl> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>—Called also magdalides, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 201" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 201</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
magdalides: <entryFree id="n27585" type="main" key="magdali^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magdalĭdes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, v. magdalia.</entryFree>
magdolus: <entryFree id="n27586" type="main" key="Magdo^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Magdŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n27586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Egypt, on the Red Sea</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 5, 527</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mage: <entryFree id="n27587" type="main" key="ma^ge_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măgē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. magis <sense id="n27587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi>, under magnus.</sense></entryFree>
magester: <entryFree id="n27588" type="gloss" key="ma^gester"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măgester</orth>, v. magister <sense id="n27588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
magganum: <entryFree id="n27589" type="main" key="magganum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magganum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">maganum</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n27589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wine-vessel made of wood</hi>, Schol. Cruq. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
magia: <entryFree id="n27590" type="greek" key="ma^gi_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măgīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">magei/a</foreign>, <sense id="n27590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the science of the</hi> Magi, <hi rend="ital">magic, sorcery</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, 16, p. 201 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 290, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">304, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 3, p. 136, 19</bibl>; p. 137, 36; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 1, 89</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
magice: <entryFree id="n27591" type="greek" key="ma^gi^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măgĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">magikh/</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">te/xnh</foreign>), <sense id="n27591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the magic art, magic, sorcery</hi> (post-Aug.): pariter utrasque artes effloruisse, medicinam<pb n="1097" /> <cb n="MAGI" />  dico magicenque, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 1, 2, § 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:7" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 1, 2, § 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magices factio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 1, 2, § 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
magicus: <entryFree id="n27592" type="greek" key="ma^gi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măgĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">magiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n27592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to magic, magic, magical</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:493" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 493</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magicis auxiliis uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:24" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma movere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superstitiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vanitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 17, 99, § 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:1:102" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 1, 102</bibl></cit> (5, 1, 106): di magici, <hi rend="ital">that were invoked by incantations</hi> (as Pluto, Hecate, Proserpine), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:62" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:577" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 577</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>hieroglyphics</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 222</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but lingua,</quote> <trans><tr>skilled in incantations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 330</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 224</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:610" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 610</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magicae resonant ubi Memnone chordae,</quote> <trans><tr>mysterious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
magida: <entryFree id="n27593" type="main" key="ma^gi^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măgĭda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. 2. magis.</entryFree>
magira: <entryFree id="n27594" type="greek" key="ma^gi_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măgīra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">ma/geiros</foreign>, a cook</etym>, <sense id="n27594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the art of cooking, cookery</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:de Fer. Als. 2" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> de Fer. Als. 2</bibl> Mai.</sense></entryFree>
magiriscium: <entryFree id="n27595" type="greek" key="ma^gi_risci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măgīriscĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mageiri/skos</foreign>, <sense id="n27595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little cook</hi>, figures made by the engraver Pytheas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 12, 57, § 157</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
magirus: <entryFree id="n27596" type="greek" key="ma^gi_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măgīrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ma/geiros</foreign>, <sense id="n27596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cook</hi> (post-class.), in mal. part.: concide, magire, Heliog. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
magis: <entryFree id="n27597" type="main" key="magis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magis</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. magnus <sense id="n27597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n27598" type="greek" key="ma^gis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măgis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">măgĭda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">magi/s</foreign>. <sense id="n27598.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A dish, platter, plate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magidam et longulam alterum a magnitudine, alterum a latitudine finxerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=120" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 120</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Cornelius Nepos tradit tympana, se juvene, appellata stateras, et lances, quas antiqui magidas vocaverant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 11, 52, § 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magidem commodare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:6:36" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 12, 6, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27598.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kneading-trough</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">in magide,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
magister: <entryFree id="n27599" type="main" key="ma^gister"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măgister</orth>, <itype>tri</itype> (old orthog., ‡ magester, like ‡ leber, ‡ Menerva, for liber, Minerva, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 17</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>a double comparative in form, from magis, and comparative ending -ter; cf.: minister, sinister</etym>, <sense id="n27599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a master, chief, head, superior, director, president, leader, commander, conductor</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus praecipua cura rerum incumbit, et qui magis quam ceteri diligentiam et sollicitudinem rebus, quibus praesunt, debent, hi magistri appellantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:57" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 57</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n27599.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27599.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">the dictator</hi> in the earliest times was called magister populi, <hi rend="ital">the chief of the people</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Magistro populi faciendo, qui vulgo dictator appellatur ... qui primus Magister a populo creatus est, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. optima lex, p. 198 Müll.: (sapiens) rectius appellabitur rex quam Tarquinius, qui nec se nec suos regere potuit: rectius magister populi (is enim dictator est) quam Sulla, qui trium pestiferorum vitiorum, luxuriae, avaritiae, crudelitatis magister fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:22:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 22, 75</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also below the passage,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=82" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 82</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictator quidem ab eo appellatur, quia dicitur: sed in nostris libris (sc. auguralibus) vides eum magistrum populi appellari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:40:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 40, 63</bibl></cit> Creuz.; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, with reference to this passage,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:31" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Larcum moderatorem et magistrum consulibus appositum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 18, 5</bibl></cit>.—Magister equitum, <hi rend="ital">the chief of the cavalry</hi>, appointed by the dictator: <cit><quote lang="la">magister equitum, quod summa potestas hujus in equites et accensos, ut est summa populi dictator, a quo is quoque magister populi appellatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=82" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 82</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">dictator magistrum equitum dicit L. Tarquitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 21</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">23, 11: fumosi equitum magistri,</quote> <trans><tr>in a family tree</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:8" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 8</bibl></cit>.—So, magister peditum (analogous to magister equitum), <hi rend="ital">chief of the infantry</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 12, 16</bibl>. —The censor is called magister morum, <hi rend="ital">master of morals</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 13, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magister sacrorum,</quote> <trans><tr>the chief priest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; v. Drak. ad loc.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">PVBLICVS SACRORVM (or SACERDOTVM),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2351</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">FRATRVM ARVALIVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2426</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">SALIORVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2247</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2419</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">LARVM AVGVSTI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1661</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">curiae,</quote> <trans><tr>the overseer of a curia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: vici, <hi rend="ital">the overseer of a quarter</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ward</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">chori canentium,</quote> <trans><tr>a head-chorister, leader of a choir</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officiorum and operarum,</quote> <trans><tr>a superintendent, bailiff</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scripturae and in scripturā,</quote> <trans><tr>a director of a company of farmers-general</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 15, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:70:section=169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 70, § 169</bibl>; cf.: P. Terentius operas in portu et scripturā Asiae pro magistro dedit, i. e. <hi rend="ital">has performed the functions of a</hi> magister, <hi rend="ital">was vice-director</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11</bibl>, <cb n="MAGI" /> 10, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">quaesivi, qui per eos annos magistri illius societatis fuissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:74:section=182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 74, § 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Rupilius, qui est magister in ea societate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximarum societatum auctor, plurimarum magister,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecoris,</quote> <trans><tr>a chief herdsman</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 445</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">elephanti,</quote> <trans><tr>conductor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:616" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 616</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctionis,</quote> <trans><tr>the director, superintendent, conductor of an auction</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 15, 50</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">is quem putabant magistrum fore, si bona venirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 1, 15</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">an officer charged with distributing money among the people</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 3</bibl>.—Law t. t., <hi rend="ital">an agent</hi> or <hi rend="ital">assignee</hi> to dispose of a debtor's goods: <cit><quote lang="la">praetor jubet convenire creditores, et ex eo numero magistrum creari, id est eum per quem bona veneant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:79" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 79</bibl></cit>: convivii, <hi rend="ital">the master</hi> or <hi rend="ital">president of a feast</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=122" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 122</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 336, 11</bibl>: navis, <hi rend="ital">the master</hi> or <hi rend="ital">captain of a ship</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:71" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 71</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so without navis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:79" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gubernatores et magistri navium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 25, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 42, 3</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">the steersman, pilot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse gubernaclo rector subit, ipse magister,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 176</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 115</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 353</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:18" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:382" default="NO">1, 382</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:696" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 696</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:719" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 719</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">samnitium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the gladiators, a fencing-master</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:23:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 23, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistri tabernae,</quote> <trans><tr>innkeepers</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—In inscrr. are found also: fani, horreorum, collegii, memoriae, munerum, Augustalis, admissionum, epistolarum, libellorum, etc.; likewise: a bibliothecā, ab marmoribus, etc.—</sense><sense id="n27599.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n27599.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A teacher, instructor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri apud magistros exercentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:57:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 57, 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artium lberalium magistri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:25:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 25, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutis magistri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:31:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 31, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:26:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 26, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rarum ac memorabile magni Gutturis exemplum conducendusque magister,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:114" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 114</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. things: <cit><quote lang="la">magister mihi exercitor animus nunc est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stilus optimus dicendi effector ac magister,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 150</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:prol. 10" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> prol. 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">timor, non diuturnus magister officii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:36:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 36, 90</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27599.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An educator of children, a tutor, pedagogue</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senes me filiis relinquunt quasi magistrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">docendis publice juvenibus magister,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:9:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 9, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n27599.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A master, owner, keeper</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trepidumque magistrum In cavea magno fremitu leo tollet alumnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:246" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 246</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27599.7" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A master</hi> of his art, <hi rend="ital">professor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a tonsore magistro Pecteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:26" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27599.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an adviser, instigator, author</hi> of any thing (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">si quis magistrum cepit ad eam rem improbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magister ad despoliandum Dianae templum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:21:section=54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 21, § 54</bibl></cit>.—As <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">rituque magistro Plurima Niliacis tradant mendacia biblis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 1, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
magisterium: <entryFree id="n27600" type="main" key="ma^giste^ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măgistĕrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>magister</etym>, <sense id="n27600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of a president, chief, director, superintendent</hi>, etc. (class.). </sense><sense id="n27600.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27600.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">dictaturā ac magisterio equitum honorata familia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the censorship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:19:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 19, 46</bibl></cit>: me magisteria delectant a majoribus instituta (sc. conviviorum), <hi rend="ital">the custom of having a master</hi> or <hi rend="ital">president at feasts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 14, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">collegii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdotii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedestre,</quote> <trans><tr>the office of a commander of infantry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 42" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 42</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of dogs: inter se exercent etiam magisteria, <hi rend="ital">the post of leader</hi> (in hunting), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 40, 61, § 148</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27600.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the office of tutor</hi> or <hi rend="ital">instructor of youth, tutorship, guardianship</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">jam excessit mi aetas ex magisterio tuo,</quote> <trans><tr>I have now outgrown your tutorship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27600.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">teaching, instruction, advice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtute id factum, et magisterio tuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:4:84" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 4, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novum,</quote> <trans><tr>method</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 27, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
magisterius: <entryFree id="n27601" type="main" key="ma^giste^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măgistĕrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">magisterial</hi> (post-class.): potestas, Cod. Th. 3, 13, 6; 3, 24, 3; 6, 8, 1.</sense></entryFree>
magistero: <entryFree id="n27602" type="main" key="ma^giste^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măgistĕro</orth>, <itype>and</itype>, sync., <orth extent="full" lang="la">măgistro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to perform the office of a director</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chief, to rule, direct, command</hi>: magisterare regere et temperare est, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=152" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 152</bibl> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">magisterare moderari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=126" default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter manipulares vitam militarem magistrans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
magistra: <entryFree id="n27603" type="main" key="ma^gistra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măgistra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mistress, superior,<cb n="MAGI" />  conductress, directress</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n27603.1" n="I" level="1"> Lit (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ludo magistra esse,</quote> <trans><tr>school-mistress, instructress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">A highpriestess</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1501</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1519</bibl> sq.; 2427 sq.—</sense><sense id="n27603.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a directress, conductress, instructress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ego ad vos discipulus venio ad magistras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: vita rustica parsimoniae magistra est. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:27:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 27, 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophia magistra vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">historia, magistra vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 9, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex quasi dux vitae et magistra officiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:15:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 15, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigus formicā quidam expavere magistrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:361" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 361</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita magistra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arte magistrā,</quote> <trans><tr>with the aid of art</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 442</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pietate magistrā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achil. 1</bibl></cit> 104.—<pos>Adj.</pos> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">artes magistrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussis parere magistris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:387" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 387</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clementia magistra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 22, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
magistralis: <entryFree id="n27604" type="main" key="ma^gistra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măgistrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>magister</etym>, <sense id="n27604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a master</hi> or <hi rend="ital">teacher</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">pergulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Saturn. 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tac. 6, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
magistras: <entryFree id="n27605" type="gloss" key="ma^gistras"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măgistras</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, v. magistratus <sense id="n27605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
magistratio: <entryFree id="n27606" type="main" key="ma^gistra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măgistrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>magistro</etym>, <sense id="n27606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">instruction, schooling</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quae magistratione discuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 15, 15</bibl></cit> (al. magistrā ratione).—</sense><sense id="n27606.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., <hi rend="ital">a school</hi>: in publicis magistrationibus, Cod. Th. 14, 9, 3.</sense></entryFree>
magistratus: <entryFree id="n27607" type="main" key="ma^gistra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măgistrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (contr. form: <sense id="n27607.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">magistras primus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3798</bibl></cit>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>magister</etym>, <hi rend="ital">the office</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rank of a</hi> magister, <hi rend="ital">a magisterial office, civil office, magistracy</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27607.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">honores, magistratus, imperia, potestates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 17, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratūs mandare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mur 35, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui committere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:25:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 25, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratum habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:61:section=137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 61, § 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtinere,</quote> <trans><tr>to hold, administer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingredi,</quote> <trans><tr>to enter upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratu abire,</quote> <trans><tr>to resign</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:20:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 20, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se abdicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in magistratu manere,</quote> <trans><tr>to remain in office</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid gerere in magistratu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:20:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 20, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc mihi deposco, quod agam in magistratu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:12:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 12, 36</bibl></cit>: lex est generale jussum populi aut plebis, rogante magistratu, Att. Cap. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:20:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 20, 2</bibl>.—There were two kinds of civil offices in Rome, magistratus extraordinarii and ordinarii. To the former belonged the dictators, the magistri equitum, the duumviri perduellionis, the quaestores rerum capitalium, the triumviri mensarii, etc. The latter were divided into the majores: the consulate, praetorship, and censorship; and the minores, to which belonged the aediles, the quaestors, the tribuni plebis, the triumviri, etc. Besides these, there were magistratus patricii, which, at first, were filled by patricians; and, on the other hand, magistratus plebeii, which were filled from the plebs; curules, who had the privilege of using the sella curulis, namely, the consuls, censors, praetors, and aediles curules. On the distinction between magistratus majores and minores, v. esp. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:15:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 15, 4</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=157" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 157</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27607.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n27607.3" n="1" level="3"> When magistratus and imperia are joined together, the former denotes magisterial offices in Rome, and the latter the authority of officers in the provinces: <cit><quote lang="la">magistratus et imperia minime mihi cupiunda videntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">juris dictionem de fidei commissis, quot annis et tantum in urbe delegari magistratibus solitam, in perpetuum atque etiam per provincias potestatibus demandavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 23</bibl></cit>: magistratus, as a general rule, is used of civil offices alone, and only by way of exception of military commands; <cit><quote lang="la">the latter were called imperia: abstinentiam neque in imperiis, neque in magistratibus praestitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27607.4" n="2" level="3"> Of <hi rend="ital">military commands</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat in classe Chabrias privatus, sed omnes, qui in magistratu erant, auctoritate anteibat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 4, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27607.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a magistrate, public functionary</hi>: quae vox (magistratus) duabus significationibus notatur. Nam aut personam ipsam demonstrat, ut cum dicimus: magistratus jussit; aut honorem, ut cum dicimus: Tito magistratus datus est, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=126" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 126</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">est proprium munus magistratūs, intelligere, se gerere personam civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:34:124" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 34, 124</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditiosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">creare magistratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 17</bibl></cit>: his enim <pb n="1098" /> <cb n="MAGN" /> magistratibus legati Romam venerunt, <hi rend="ital">in their consulate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter filium magistratum et patrem privatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n27607.6" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">sing. collect., the body of magistrates, the municipal administration</hi> (cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)rxh/</foreign> = <foreign lang="greek">a)/rxontes</foreign>; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): ad magistratum senatumque Lacedaemoniorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 7</bibl></cit>. 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lys. 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Epam. 4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Epam. 4, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
magistrianus: <entryFree id="n27608" type="main" key="ma^gistri^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măgistrĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>magister</etym>, <sense id="n27608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">caused by a master or teacher</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Contin. Verg. p. 160</bibl> Muncker.</sense></entryFree>
magistro: <entryFree id="n27609" type="main" key="ma^gistro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">măgistro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. magistero.</entryFree>
magma: <entryFree id="n27610" type="main" key="magma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ma/gma</foreign>, <sense id="n27610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the dregs of an unguent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">faecem unguenti magma appellant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 2, 3, § 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 157" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 157</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
magmatarius: <entryFree id="n27611" type="gloss" key="magma^ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magmătārĭus</orth> <etym>magma</etym>, <foreign lang="greek">mureyo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n27611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who prepares unguents</hi>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
magmentarius: <entryFree id="n27612" type="main" key="magmenta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magmentārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>magmentum</etym>, <sense id="n27612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an addition made to a sacrifice</hi> (ante-class.): magmentum a magis, quod ad religionem magis pertinet; <cit><quote lang="la">itaque propter hoc magmentaria fana instituta locis certis, quo id imponeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=112" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 112</bibl></cit> Müll.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">magmentārĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. sacellum), <hi rend="ital">a sanctuary for additional sacrifices</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">putant enim ad me non nulli pertinere magmentarium Telluris aperire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 14, 31</bibl></cit>: magmentarium <foreign lang="greek">e)f) ou(= ta\ spla/gxna a)natiqe/mena toi=s bwmoi=s prosfe/rontai</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
magmentatus: <entryFree id="n27613" type="main" key="magmenta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magmentātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">increased by an addition</hi> to a sacrifice, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=126:4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 126, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
magmentum: <entryFree id="n27614" type="gloss" key="magmentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>contr. from magimentum, from root mag; cf. mactare and mactus</etym>.—In relig. lang., <sense id="n27614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which magnifies</hi> or <hi rend="ital">glorifies, an offering, sacrifice</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2489</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2490</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 23, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">229, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 24</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in preced.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=112" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 112</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
magnaevus: <entryFree id="n27615" type="gloss" key="magnaevus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magnaevus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">a)rxaioge/rwn</foreign>, <sense id="n27615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a great age</hi>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
magnagraecia: <entryFree id="n27616" type="main" key="Magna Graecia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Magna Graecia</orth>, v. Graecia, under Graeci.</entryFree>
magnalia: <entryFree id="n27617" type="main" key="magna_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magnālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>magnus</etym>, <sense id="n27617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">great things, mighty works</hi> or <hi rend="ital">words</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">sensit magnalia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Uxor. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loquitur magnalia mutus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 2, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
magnanimis: <entryFree id="n27618" type="main" key="magna^ni^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magnănĭmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> <etym>magnus, animus</etym> (rare and post-class.), <sense id="n27618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">high-minded, magnanimous</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Patient. 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
magnanimitas: <entryFree id="n27619" type="main" key="magna^ni^mi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magnănĭmĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>magnanimus</etym>, <sense id="n27619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">greatness of soul, magnanimity</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnis honestas manat a partibus quatuor, quarum una est cognitionis, altera communitatis, tertia magnanimitatis, quarta moderationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:43:152" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 43, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnanimitas fuit expetito semper honore abstinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:58:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 58, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 74:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 74, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:115:3" default="NO">115, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:5:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Clem. 1, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 25, 26, § 93</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:18 al" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 18 al.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 11, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
magnanimus: <entryFree id="n27620" type="main" key="magna^ni^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magnănĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>magnus, animus</etym>, <sense id="n27620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">great-souled, magnanimous</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">viri fortes, magnanimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:19:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 19, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:28:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 28, 61</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Juba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:380" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 380</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heroës,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:649" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 649</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Acragas, magnanimūm quondam generator equorum,</quote> <trans><tr>high-spirited, mettlesome</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 704</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberale atque magnanimum factum,</quote> <trans><tr>highsouled, magnanimous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6</bibl></cit> (7), 19, 1.</sense></entryFree>
magnarius: <entryFree id="n27621" type="main" key="magna_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>magnus</etym>, <sense id="n27621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to what is great</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in the gross</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">negotiator magnarius,</quote> <trans><tr>a dealer in gross, wholesale dealer</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 104, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">PISTOR,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4264</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 283, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
magnatus: <entryFree id="n27622" type="hapax" key="magna_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magnātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">magnas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a great man, important person, magnate</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnes magnates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in conspectu magnatorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sir. 38, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">33, 19</bibl>; Inscr. ap. Demster. ad Rosini Antiq. 2, 12: magnates, <foreign lang="greek">megista=nes</foreign>, Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
magne: <entryFree id="n27623" type="spur" key="magne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magne</orth>, l. fals. for magna, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 36</bibl>.</entryFree>
magnes: <entryFree id="n27624" type="greek" key="magnes1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magnes</orth>, <itype>ētis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ma/gnhs</foreign>, with or without lapis, <sense id="n27624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a magnet, loadstone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(lapis), quem magneta vocant patrio de nomine Grai Magnetum quia sit patriis in finibus ortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:908" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 908</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 16, 25, § 126</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1046" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1046</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:39:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 39, 86</bibl>.—Without lapis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:265" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 265</bibl>.—Hence, <cb n="MAGN" /> <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">magnētĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">magnetic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> de Magnet. 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n27625" type="main" key="Magnes2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Magnes</orth>, <itype>ētis</itype>, v. Magnesia, II. D.</entryFree>
magnesia: <entryFree id="n27626" type="main" key="Magne_sia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Magnēsia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*magnhsi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n27626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a geographical proper name</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27626.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A country in Thessaly, on the Ægean Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 9, 16, § 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:54:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 54, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 11, 3</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n27626.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Caria, on the Mæander</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Aineh Bazar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 31, § 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:45:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 45, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 10, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27626.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A city in Lydia, on Mount Sipylus</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Manisa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 91, 93, § 205</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:43:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 43, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 10, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 11, 3</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n27626.4" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Magnēsĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*magnh/sios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Magnesia, Magnesian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Magnesia flumine saxa,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the magnet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1064" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1064</bibl></cit>; v. 1. magnes.—</sense><sense id="n27626.5" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Magnessa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ma/gnhssa</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a Magnesian woman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Magnessam Hippolyten dum fugit abstinens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27626.6" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Magnētarches</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*magnhta/rxhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the chief magistrate of the Magnesians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:31:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 31, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:39:6" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 39, 6</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n27626.7" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Magnētes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ma/gnhtes</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the Magnesians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34" default="NO" valid="yes">34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:31" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(lapis) Magnetum quia sit patriis in finibus ortus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:909" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 909</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:385" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 385</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Magnetas adit vagus exsul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 408</bibl></cit>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Magnes</orth>, <itype>ētis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Magnesian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dionysius Magnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:91:316" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 91, 316</bibl></cit>.—As <pos>adj.</pos>, Magnes campus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27626.8" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mag-nētis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">*magnh=tis</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Magnesia, Magnesian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur umquam Colchi Magnetida vidimus Argo? (because built at Pagasae, in Magnesia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
magnicampi: <entryFree id="n27627" type="main" key="Magni Campi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Magni Campi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, translation of <foreign lang="greek">ta\ mega/la pedi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n27627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place in Africa near Utica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 8, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
magnicies: <entryFree id="n27628" type="main" key="magni^cies"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magnĭcies</orth>, v. magnities.</entryFree>
magnidicus: <entryFree id="n27629" type="main" key="magni^di^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magnĭdĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>magnusdico</etym>, <sense id="n27629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that talks big, boastful, bragging</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Persae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 80</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">mendacia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
magnifacio: <entryFree id="n27630" type="main" key="magni^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magnĭfăcĭo</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">magnī făcĭo</orth>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>magnus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n27630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make</hi> or <hi rend="ital">think much of</hi> a thing (ante-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
magnificatio: <entryFree id="n27631" type="main" key="magni^fi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magnĭfĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>magnifico</etym>, <sense id="n27631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making much of, making great, magnifying</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">personarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 13, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
magnifice: <entryFree id="n27632" type="main" key="magni^fi^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magnĭfĭcē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">magnĭfĭcenter</orth>, <sense id="n27632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. magnificus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
magnificens: <entryFree id="n27633" type="main" key="magni^fi^cens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magnĭfĭcens</orth>, v. magnificus.</entryFree>
magnificentia: <entryFree id="n27634" type="main" key="magni^fi^centi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magnĭfĭcentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>magnificus</etym>, <sense id="n27634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">greatness</hi> in action or in sentiment, <hi rend="ital">nobleness, distinction, eminence, high-mindedness, magnanimity;</hi> in a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">boasting, bragging</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n27634.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n27634.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnificentia est rerum magnarum et excelsarum cum anima ampla quadam et splendida propositione agitatio atque administratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54:163" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 54, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et magnificentia et despicientia adhibenda est rerum humanarum,</quote> <trans><tr>greatness of soul</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:21:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 21, 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 8, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27634.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanimate things, <hi rend="ital">grandeur, magnificence, splendor, sumptuousness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">epularum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:25:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 25, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:140" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 39, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funerum et sepulcrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:26:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 26, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberalitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra modum sumptu et magnificentia prodire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 39, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exhaustus magnificentiā publicorum operum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnificentiae studium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publica magnificentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27634.4" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n27634.5" n="1" level="3"> Rhet. t. t., <hi rend="ital">an imposing style, sounding</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dignified language</hi>: his tribus narrandi virtutibus adiciunt quidam magnificentiam, quam <foreign lang="greek">megalopre/peian</foreign> vocant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:61 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 61 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n27634.6" n="2" level="3"> In a bad sense: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum magnificentia,</quote> <trans><tr>pomposity of language, bombast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:6:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">i hinc in malam crucem cum istac magnificentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 7, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27634.7" n="3" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">greatness of talent, great artistic skill</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
magnificium: <entryFree id="n27635" type="gloss" key="magni^fi^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magnĭfĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>magnifico</etym>, <foreign lang="greek">megaloergi/a</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</entryFree>
magnifico: <entryFree id="n27636" type="main" key="magni^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magnĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>magnificus</etym>. <sense id="n27636.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To make much of, to value greatly, esteem highly, set a high value on</hi> (ante-class. and late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te quia me colitis et magnificatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum ex omnibus Venus voluit me magnificare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3</bibl></cit>, <cb n="MAGN" /> 19: <cit><quote lang="la">illam haud minus quam se ipsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob tuam perfidiam te amo et metuo et magnifico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est homo, quia magnificas eum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 7, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27636.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to magnify, extol, praise highly</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Arcesilaum quoque magnificat Varro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 45, § 155</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:41" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 5, 4, § 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 9, 6, § 50</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 12, 18, § 83</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 4, 8</bibl> Klotz. —</sense><sense id="n27636.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To praise, glorify, worship</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnificate Dominum mecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 34, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deum Israël,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:15:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 15, 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27636.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To exalt, honor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen tuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Salomonem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Paral. 29, 25.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnificabor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:38:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 38, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27636.4" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To enlarge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fimbrias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 23, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
magnificus: <entryFree id="n27637" type="main" key="magni^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magnĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (<sense id="n27637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> magnificentior; <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> magnificentissimus; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr>; old form of <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> magnificior, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=154" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 154</bibl> Müll., and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> magnificissimus, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=151" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 151</bibl>; so in the <pos>adv.</pos> magnificissime, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 603</bibl> P.) [magnus-facio], <hi rend="ital">great</hi> in deeds or in sentiment, <hi rend="ital">noble, distinguished, eminent, august, great in soul, high-minded</hi> (cf. splendidus). </sense><sense id="n27637.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27637.2" n="A" level="2"> In a good sense (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vir factis magnificus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhodiorum civitas magna atque magnifica,</quote> <trans><tr>great, glorious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus excelsus magnificusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:23:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 23, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cives in suppliciis deorum magnifici, domi parci,</quote> <trans><tr>magnificent, splendid, grand, fond of splendor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elegans, non magnificus,</quote> <trans><tr>fond of show</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnificus in publicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:51:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 51, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:130" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 130</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27637.3" n="B" level="2"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">bragging, boastful</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum magnifico milite, urbis verbis qui inermus capit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 84</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27637.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. and abstr. things, <hi rend="ital">splendid, rich, fine, costly, sumptuous, magnificent</hi>, etc. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">magnificae villae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 19, 22, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:8:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:22:section=58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 22, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:8:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res gestae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of speech, <hi rend="ital">of high strain, lofly, sublime</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus dicendi magnificum atque praeclarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:21:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 21, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 4, 9, § 26</bibl></cit>; cf. in the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnificentius dicendi genus et ornatius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:32:123" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 32, 123</bibl></cit>.—In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">boastful, bragging</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 44</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Crassus magnificentissimā aedilitate functus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 16</bibl></cit>.—Of medicaments, <hi rend="ital">valuable, useful, admirable</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 3, 15, § 38</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in two forms: <orth extent="full" lang="la">magnĭfĭcē</orth> <itype>and</itype> (postAug.) <orth extent="full" lang="la">magnĭfĭcenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">nobly, magnificently, generously, grandly, sumptuously, richly, splendidly, excellently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnifice conscreabor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cesso magnifice patriceque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnifice laudare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:73:254" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 73, 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornare convivium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 30, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comparare convivi um,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26:section=65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 26, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincere,</quote> <trans><tr>splendidly, gloriously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radicula ex melle prodest magnifice ad tussim,</quote> <trans><tr>admirably, excellently</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 11, 58, § 96</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:139" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 14, 47, § 139</bibl>.—In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">pompously, proudly, haughtily, boastfully</hi>: se jactare. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 21, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">incedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—In the form magnificenter: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum magnificenter aedificatum et eleganter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnificentius et dicere et sentire,</quote> <trans><tr>grandly, loftily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:34:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 34, 119</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatum magnificentissime gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriosissime et magnificentissime aliquid conficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: jactare se, 2, 21, 3.</sense></entryFree>
magniloquax: <entryFree id="n27638" type="gloss" key="magni^lo^quax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magnĭlŏquax</orth> <etym>magnus-loquor</etym>, <sense id="n27638.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">talking largely</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">megalola/los</foreign>, Gloss. Graec. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
