magniloquentia: <entryFree id="n27639" type="main" key="magni^lo^quenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magnĭlŏquentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>magniloquus</etym>. <sense id="n27639.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Elevated language, a lofty style</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strain</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hexametrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:57:191" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 57, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Homeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecarum facundiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:7:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27639.1" n="II" level="1"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">pompous language, magniloquence, boasting</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quā auditā re, principem legationis, cujus magniloquentiam vix curia paulo ante ceperat, corruisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulatorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 12, 69</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
magniloquium: <entryFree id="n27640" type="main" key="magni^lo^qui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magnĭlŏquĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27640.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pomposity, boasting</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 17, 4, 3.</sense></entryFree>
magniloquus: <entryFree id="n27641" type="main" key="magni^lo^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magnĭlŏquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>magnusloquor</etym>, <sense id="n27641.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that speaks in a lofty style, sublime</hi>: <pb n="1099" /> <cb n="MAGN" /> Homerus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:62" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 62</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27641.1" n="II" level="1"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">that speaks in a pompous style, magniloquent, vaunting, boastful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque illi modo cauti ac sapientes, prompti post eventum ac magniloqui erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 396</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:43:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 43, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:192" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 192</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
magnipendo: <entryFree id="n27642" type="main" key="magni pendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magni pendo</orth>, v. pendo.</entryFree>
magnisonans: <entryFree id="n27643" type="hapax" key="magni^so^nans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magnĭsŏnans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>magnussono</etym>, <sense id="n27643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">loud-sounding</hi>: saxa, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 463, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
magnisonus: <entryFree id="n27644" type="main" key="magni^so^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magnĭsŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>magnussonus</etym>, <sense id="n27644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">loud-sounding</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">tubae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Intpr. Orig. in Jerem. Hom. 3, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
magnitas: <entryFree id="n27645" type="hapax" key="magni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magnĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>magnus</etym>, <sense id="n27645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">greatness, magnitude</hi>, for magnitudo, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 136, 27</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 248 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
magnities: <entryFree id="n27646" type="hapax" key="magni^ti^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magnĭtĭes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-cĭes</orth>), <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">greatness, size</hi>, for magnitudo (of the ostrich), Auct. Carm. de Phoenic. 145.</sense></entryFree>
magnitudo: <entryFree id="n27647" type="main" key="magni^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magnĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n27647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">greatness, size, bulk, magnitude</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n27647.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27647.2" n="A" level="2"> Silvestres apes minores sunt magnitudine, <hi rend="ital">in size</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:43:154" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 43, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris Aegaei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:14:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 14, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad fabae magnitudinem,</quote> <trans><tr>of the size of, as large as</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 25, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habebat ursos ferociae ac magnitudini suae simillimos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 21, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Goliath quidam, vir mirae magnitudinis et roboris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Chron. 1, 34, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elephantus ferus infinitae magnitudinis ultro se obtulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:4:19" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 15, 4, 19</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnitudines regionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27647.3" n="B" level="2"> Of number and amount, <hi rend="ital">a great number, great quantity, abundance, great amount</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:9:section=22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 9, § 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27647.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27647.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">greatness, vastness, extent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnitudo et vis amoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acerbitatis et odii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 11, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 3, 7, § 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 2, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <trans><tr>greatness of soul</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 23, 81</bibl></cit>.— Rhetorically: vocis, <hi rend="ital">the strength</hi> or <hi rend="ital">compass of the voice</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 11, 20</bibl>.— Of time: dierum ac noctium magnitudines, <hi rend="ital">length</hi>, Plin 36, 10, 15, § 72.—</sense><sense id="n27647.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">rank, dignity</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">imperatoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infra tuam magnitudinem,</quote> <trans><tr>beneath your dignity</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 54</bibl></cit>. —Hence, in late Lat., as a title of honor, <hi rend="ital">highness, excellency</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnitudo tua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 9, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 27, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
magnopere: <entryFree id="n27648" type="main" key="magno^pe^re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magnŏpĕrē</orth> (so written by Plaut., Cæs., Liv., and Sen., but ap. Ter., Cic., Plin. H. N., the best MSS. and edd. have <orth extent="full" lang="la">magnō opĕre</orth>; cf. <sense id="n27648.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Ellendt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:35:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 35, 164</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Osann,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:8:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 8, 13</bibl></cit>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>magnus-opus, with great labor; hence, in gen.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">very much, greatly, exceedingly, particularly, earnestly</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27648.1" n="A" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">verbs</hi> and <hi rend="ital">verbal adjj.</hi>, etc. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">edictum est magnopere mihi, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Gellius philosophis magno opere auctor fuit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:20:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 20, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego tibi Romam properandum, magno opere censeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 14, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:86:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 86, 353</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">desidero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:13:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 13, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullā magnopere clade acceptā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 26</bibl></cit>.—Esp., with words denoting mental action, as velle, petere, orare, hortari, desiderare, mirari, etc., <hi rend="ital">strongly, vehemently, with all one's heart, zealously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc etiam magnopere oravit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno opere velle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnopere cohortatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:71:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 71, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desiderare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 13, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 16, 56</bibl></cit>; so with putare, censere, providere, etc., <hi rend="ital">strongly, earnestly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">putare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 13, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censeo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 14, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 18, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā de re, judices, vobis magno opere providendum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:10:section=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 10, § 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: nulla magno opere expectatio est, <hi rend="ital">no very great</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 1</bibl>.—In tmesi: <cit><quote lang="la">magnoque opere abs te peto, cures, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 34</bibl></cit>. —In the contrary order: opere magno edicite, ut etc., Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 357, 13</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 508 Rib.).—In <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: quo majore opere dico suadeoque, uti, etc., <hi rend="ital">the more</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 3, 4</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meministin' mihi te maximopere dicere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a te maximo opere etiam atque etiam quaeso et peto, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>most particularly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximopere indigne ferens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 57</bibl></cit>.—In tmesi: Thais maximo te <cb n="MAGN" /> orabat opere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 26</bibl>.—In inverted order: <cit><quote lang="la">rogare jussit te opere maximo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos ambo opere maximo dabamus operam, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27648.2" n="B" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">adjectives</hi> = valde (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">id ego Tadio et gratum esse intellexi et magno opere jucundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
magnus: <entryFree id="n27649" type="main" key="magnus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">magnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (archaic <sense id="n27649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> magnai for magnae: <cit><quote lang="la">magnai reipublicai gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 23</bibl></cit>), <hi rend="ital">adj.; comp.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mājor</orth>, us; <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">maxĭmus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">maxŭm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>root magh-; Sanscr. mahat, mabā, great; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">me/gas</foreign>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">mei/zwn</foreign> for <foreign lang="greek">megiwn</foreign>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">mh=xos</foreign>, majestas; also cf. root mak-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">makro/s</foreign>, and perh. <foreign lang="greek">ma/kar</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">great, large</hi>. </sense><sense id="n27649.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of physical size or quantity, <hi rend="ital">great, large;</hi> of things, <hi rend="ital">vast, extensive, spacious</hi>, etc.: nequam et magnus homo, <hi rend="ital">a great, tall fellow</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=32" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 32</bibl> Müll.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the double meaning: tu, bis denis grandia libris Qui scribis Priami proelia, magnus homo es,</quote> <trans><tr>a great man</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:51:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 51, 4</bibl></cit>: magna ossa lacertique Apparent homini, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna ossa lacertosque Exuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 422</bibl></cit>: (scarus) magnusque bonusque, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 299</bibl> (Heduph. v. 9 Vahl.): indu mari magno, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> 6, 2</bibl> (Ann. v. 425 Vahl.); so, in mari magno, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=356" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 356</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:554" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 554</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnus fluens Nilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:2:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna et pulcra domus,</quote> <trans><tr>spacious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64</bibl></cit>. 280; cf. Olympum, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 20</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 1 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">templa caelitum,</quote> <trans><tr>vast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit>, § 6 (Trag. v. 227 Vahl.): magnae quercus, <hi rend="ital">great oaks, lofty oaks</hi>, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 2</bibl> (Ann. v. 194 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <trans><tr>great floods, inundations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 9</bibl></cit>: saxa maxima, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:16:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 16, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum maximum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27649.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n27649.3" n="1" level="3"> Of measure, weight, quantity, <hi rend="ital">great, much, abundant, considerable</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">maximum pondus auri, magnum numerum frumenti, vim mellis maximam exportasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:72:section=176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 72, § 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna pecunia mutua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copia pabuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo peditatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion. 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 148</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27649.4" n="2" level="3"> Rarely of time, for longus, multus: <cit><quote lang="la">interea magnum sol circumvolvitur annum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:284" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 284</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum vocans solis (annum) comparatione lunaris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno post tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:10:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 10, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:3:10" default="NO">32, 3, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27649.5" n="3" level="3"> Of the voice, <hi rend="ital">loud, powerful, strong, mighty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnā voce confiteri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:32:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 32, 92</bibl></cit>: major pars, <hi rend="ital">the majority</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:46:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 46, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n27649.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27649.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">great, grand, mighty, noble, lofty, important, of great weight</hi> or <hi rend="ital">importance, momentous</hi>: cum magnis dis, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl> (Ann. v. 207 Vahl.); cf.: Saturnia magna dearum, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1103</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 482 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">vir magnus in primis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:43:120" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 43, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo igitur vir magnus sine aliquo adflatu divino umquam fuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 66, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnus hoc bello Themistocles fuit, nec minor in pace,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cato clarus atque magnus habetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 53:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 53, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicus,</quote> <trans><tr>great, wealthy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:312" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 312</bibl></cit>: res magnas parvasque Eloqui, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 244 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infamia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentia, gravitas, studium, contentio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo major alacritas, studiumque pugnandi majus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <trans><tr>great, important, weighty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus et arduum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 10, 33</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> in <hi rend="ital">neutr, sing.</hi> and <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam id magnum, et arduum est,</quote> <trans><tr>something great</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: magna Di curant (<hi rend="ital">great things, important matters</hi>), parva neglegunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:66:167" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 66, 167</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna loqui,</quote> <trans><tr>to say great things, speak boastfully</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:6:11" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnum est efficere, ut quis intellegat, quid sit illud, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>it is a great, difficult, important thing</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probitatem vel in eis, quos numquam vidimus, vel, quod majus est, in hoste etiam diligimus,</quote> <trans><tr>what is far greater</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 9, 29</bibl></cit>: annus magnus, <hi rend="ital">the great year</hi>, at the end of which the sun, moon, and planets were supposed to return to the same relative positions, <hi rend="ital">the Piatonic year</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cycle</hi>, consisting of 15000 years: <cit><quote lang="la">quarum (stellarum) ex disparibus motionibus, magnum annum mathematici nominaverunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 20, 52</bibl></cit>; id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 16</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Posit.</hi> in comparison:<cb n="MAGN" />  Alexander orbi magnus est, Alex. andro orbis angustus, <hi rend="ital">great in comparison with</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">too great for</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 1, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27649.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n27649.9" n="1" level="3"> Of age, with natu, <hi rend="ital">advanced in years, of great age, aged</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam magno natu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:71:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 71, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo magnus natu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:38:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 38, 6</bibl></cit>.—Usually in the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, with or without natu or annis, <hi rend="ital">older, the elder, the oldest</hi> or <hi rend="ital">eldest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Livius) fuit major natu quam Plautus et Naevius,</quote> <trans><tr>older than, earlier</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audivi ex majoribus natu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 30, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic una e multis, quae maxima natu, Pyrgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:644" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 644</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annos natus major quadraginta,</quote> <trans><tr>more than</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 14, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civis major annis viginti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum liberis, majoribus quam quindecim annos natis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 32</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: senis nostri frater major, <hi rend="ital">the elder</hi> of two, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex duobus filiis major, Caes B. C. 3, 108, 3: Fabii Ambusti filiae duae nuptae, Ser. Sulpicio major minor Licinio Stoloni erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gelo maximus stirpis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nubere vellet mulier viro, major juniori,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 27, p. 291, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in gen.: Cyrus major,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerere uter major aetate fuerit, Homerus an Hesiodus, cum minor Hecuba fuerit quam Helena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 5</bibl></cit>.—In legal lang., major (opp. minor), <hi rend="ital">one who has attained his twenty-fifth year, who is of age</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si minor negotiis majoris intervenerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 4, 24</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mājō-res</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">adults</hi> (opp. pueri), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:10:section=16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, 10, § 16</bibl> Müll.—But usually majores, <hi rend="ital">ancestors, forefathers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Itan tandem hanc majores famam tradiderunt tibi tui, Ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi mei sunt majores siti, pater, avos, proavos, abavos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Philippus, vir patre, avo, majoribus suis dignissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patres majoresque nostri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:21:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 21, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">more majorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes tamen una est, aliquando populum Romanum majorum similem fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majores natu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Iphicr. 1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Iphicr. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxima virgo,</quote> <trans><tr>the eldest of the Vestal virgins</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:639" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 639</bibl></cit>: major erus, <hi rend="ital">the old master, the master of the house, the old man</hi> (opp.: minor erus, <hi rend="ital">the young master</hi>): <hi rend="ital">Le.</hi> Ubinam est erus? <hi rend="ital">Li.</hi> Major apud forum'st, minor hic est intus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 63</bibl>: majores natu, of <hi rend="ital">the Senate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de istis rebus in patriā majores natu consulemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32, 10</bibl></cit>.—In designating relationship, magnus denotes kindred of the fourth, major of the fifth, and maximus of the sixth degree; so, avunculus magnus, <hi rend="ital">a great-uncle;</hi> amita magna, <hi rend="ital">a greataunt;</hi> avunculus or amita major; avunculus maximus, amita maxima, etc.; v. h. vv., and cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27649.10" n="2" level="3"> In specifications of value, in the <hi rend="ital">neutr. absol.</hi>, magni or magno, <hi rend="ital">high, dear, of great value, at a high price</hi>, etc.; cf.: pretii majoris or maximi, <hi rend="ital">higher, highest, very high</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magni esse,</quote> <trans><tr>to be highly esteemed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:72:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 72, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magni aestimare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:7:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magni existimans interesse ad decus,</quote> <trans><tr>to be of great consequence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emere agros poterunt quam volent magno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 13, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno vendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:30:section=71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 30, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conducere aliquid nimium magno,</quote> <trans><tr>too high, too dear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 17, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno illi ea cunctatio stetit,</quote> <trans><tr>cost him dear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 36</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornatus muliebris majoris pretii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv 1, 31, 51</bibl></cit>, rarely without pretii: <cit><quote lang="la">multo majoris alapae mecum veneunt,</quote> <trans><tr>dearer, higher</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 5, 25</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: te haec solum semper fecit maxumi, <hi rend="ital">most highly prized</hi>, Ter And. 1, 5, 58: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus auctoritatem sibi maximi videri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: in majus, <hi rend="ital">too greatly, too highly, greater than it is</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">extollere aliquid in majus,</quote> <trans><tr>more highly than it deserves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">celebrare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">credere,</quote> <trans><tr>to believe a thing to be worse than it is</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipere,</quote> <trans><tr>to take a thing to be greater than it is</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: innotescere, <hi rend="ital">in an exaggerated manner</hi>, id. ib 4, 50.—Also with <case>abl.</case>, in majus vero ferri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:32:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 32, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27649.11" n="3" level="3"> Magnum and maximum, adverbially, <hi rend="ital">greatly, loudly</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">magnum clamat,</quote> <trans><tr>greatly, with a loud voice, aloud</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inclamare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exclamat derepente maximum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 57</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">măgis</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, only in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> in this anomalous form (i. e. mag-ius, like pris-cus for <pb n="1100" /> <cb n="MAGN" /> prius-cus, and pris-tinus for prius-tinus); and in <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">maxĭmē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">maxŭmē</orth>). </sense><sense id="n27649.12" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">magĭs</orth> (apocop. form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">măgĕ</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mon. 2, 3, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 75</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:756" default="NO" valid="yes">756</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1203" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1203</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:11:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 11, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO">3</bibl> (4), 14, 2; 4 (5), 8, 16; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 481</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; but in Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 13, 2</bibl>, magis or magi'. Acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 10, 481</bibl>, Cicero in the Frumentaria wrote: mage condemnatum hominum in judicium adducere non posse), <hi rend="ital">in a higher degree, more completely, more</hi> (for the difference between magis, plus, potius, and amplius, v. amplius).—</sense><sense id="n27649.13" n="B" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n27649.14" n="1" level="3"> With no qualifying words. </sense><sense id="n27649.15" n="a" level="4"> With the addition of the second term of the comparison. </sense><sense id="n27649.16" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">verbs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (facinora) istaec aetas fugere magis quam sectari solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saliendo sese exercebant magis, quam scorto aut saviis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 108</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis honorem tribuere quam salutem accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 20, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi forte magis erit parricida, si qui consularem patrem, quam si quis humilem necarit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis ut consuetudinem servem, quam quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:32:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 32, 89</bibl></cit>.—Repeated: <cit><quote lang="la">quam magis exhausto spumaverit ubere mulctra, Laeta magis pressis manabunt flumina mammis, i. e. quo magis, ... eo magis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:309 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 309 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tam magis illa fremens ... quam magis effuso crudescunt sanguine pugnae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 787</bibl></cit> sq.; v. Hand, Turs. III. p. 566.—Magis est, quod or ut, <hi rend="ital">there is greater reason, there is more cause that</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quamobrem etsi magis est, quod gratuler tibi, quam quod te rogem: tamen etiam rogo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis est, ut ipse moleste ferat, errasse se, quam ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 6, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27649.17" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi>, usu. with <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: tu me amoris magis quam honoris servavisti gratiā, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:32:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 32, 69</bibl>: bellipotentes sunt magi' quam sapientipotentes, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:56:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 56, 116</bibl> (Ann. v. 188 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">umbra es amantum magis quam amator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis adeo id facilitate quam alia ulla culpa mea contigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditus ad consulatum non magis nobilitati quam virtuti pateret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 8, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis ratione et consilio quam virtute vicisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut magis virtute quam dolo contenderent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se magis consuetudine suā quam merito eorum civitatem conservaturum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 32, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timori magis quam religioni consulere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:67:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 67, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus bonumque apud eos non legibus magis quam naturā valebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non duces magis quam milites callent (obsistere, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:2:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 2, 14</bibl></cit>.—And after negatives: non magis quam, <hi rend="ital">as little as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dicendo irasci, dolere ... non sunt figurae, non magis quam suadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanos nec magis jam dolo capi quam armis vinci posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro certo habens non magis Antonio eripi se quam Caesari Brutum posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 6:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non magis Alexandri saevitiam quam Bessi parricidium ferre potuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:6:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 6, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec magis post proelium quam in proelio caedibus temperatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 16, 9</bibl></cit>. —Followed by <hi rend="ital">atque</hi> instead of <hi rend="ital">quam</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">non Apollinis magis verum atque hoc responsum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 2, 15</bibl></cit>.— With the <hi rend="ital">comp. abl.</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quid philosophiā magis colendum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:22:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 22, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto magis Aliensi die Aliam ipsam reformidaturos?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 28, 6</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quam Juno fertur terris magis omnibus unam ... coluisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 15</bibl></cit> (cf. B. 3. infra): <cit><quote lang="la">Albanum sive Falernum Te magis appositis delectat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 17</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n27649.18" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">pronn.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid habetis, qui mage immortales vos credam esse quam ego siem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis homo sit magis meus quam tu es?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam mage amo quam matrem meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 3, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ego ecastor mage amo quam me,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 34</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">utrum</hi>, followed by <hi rend="ital">an</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam scibo, utrum haec me mage amet, an marsupium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 35</bibl></cit>.—With the <case>abl.</case> instead of <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec magis hac infra quicquam est in corpore nostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:274" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 274</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27649.19" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, and esp. with those which do not admit the comparative termination (most freq. without adding the second term of the comparison; v. under b. <foreign lang="greek">d</foreign>): numquam potuisti mihi Magis opportunus<cb n="MAGN" />  advenire quam advenis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque lac lacti magis est simile, quam ille ego similis est mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars magis magna atque uber, quam difficilis et obscura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:42:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 42, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora magna magis quam firma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 44, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultu pulchro magis quam venusto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 51</bibl></cit>.—With the <case>abl.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ego hoc homine quemquam vidi magis malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab secundis rebus magis etiam solito incauti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:44:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 44, 6</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">compp.</hi> (adding to their force): <cit><quote lang="la">ita fustibus sum mollior miser magis quam ullus cinaedus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 2, 8</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n27649.20" n="b" level="4"> Without the addition of the second term. </sense><sense id="n27649.21" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">verbs</hi>: ergo plusque magisque viri nunc gloria claret, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 315 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">sapiunt magis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis curae est, magisque afformido, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis metuant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 5, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum magis id diceres, Fanni, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:40:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 40, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Pompeius ita contendisset, ut nihil umquam magis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis velle, for malle: quod magis vellem evenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:270" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 270</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27649.22" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi>: non ex jure manum consertum sed magi' ferro, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 10</bibl> (Ann. v. 276 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">magis aedilis fieri non potuisset,</quote> <trans><tr>better, finer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:24:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 24, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27649.23" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">pronn.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecastor neminem hodie mage Amat corde atque animo suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 75</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27649.24" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi> (so most freq.).—With <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quadam magis necessaria ratione recte sit vivendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:1:section=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis anxius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic magis tranquillu'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil videtur mundius, nec magis compositum quicquam, nec magis elegans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo fuit magis severus nec magis continens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod est magis verisimile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis admirabilis oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis communia verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 2, 24</bibl></cit> et saep.; rare: magis quam in aliis = praeter ceteros; <cit><quote lang="la">nescio quo pacto magis quam in aliis suum cuique pulchrum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:22:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 22, 63</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis aperte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis impense,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 9, 36</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">compp.</hi> adding to their force: <cit><quote lang="la">magis est dulcius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis majores nugae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. prol. 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis modum in majorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contentiores mage erunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 2, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27649.25" n="2" level="3"> Strengthened. </sense><sense id="n27649.26" n="a" level="4"> By <hi rend="ital">etiam, multo, tanto, eo, hoc, quo, tam, quam;</hi> and negatively, <hi rend="ital">nihilo</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualis in dicendo Hierocles Alabandeus, magis etiam Menecles, frater ejus, fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:95:325" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 95, 325</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:21:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 21, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud ad me, ac multo etiam magis ad vos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:32:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 32, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanto magis Dic, quis est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quidque magis contemplor, tanto magis placet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 2, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicina cacumina caelo, quam sint magis, tanto magis fument,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 460</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto ille plura miscebat, tanto hic magis in dies convalescebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed eo magis cauto est Opus, ne huc exeat, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque eo magis, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eoque magis quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 14</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 1: immo vero etiam hoc magis, quam illi veteres, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc vero magis properare Varro, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo magis cogito ego cum meo animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis quam id reputo, tam magis uror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam magis illa fremens ... Quam magis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:787" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 787</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto mage ... tam magis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:81 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 81 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam magis in pectore meo foveo, quas meus filius turbas turbet ... magis curae est magisque afformido, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 1, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam magis te in altum capessis, tam aestus te in portum refert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">densior hinc suboles Quam magis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 309</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Vercingetorix nihilo magis in aequum locum descenderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27649.27" n="b" level="4"> By reduplication: magis magisque, magis et magis, magis ac magis; and <usg type="style">poet.</usg> also, magis magis, <hi rend="ital">more and more</hi>: ex desiderio magis magisque maceror, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 182</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum cotidie magis magisque perditi homines tectis ac templis urbis minarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 5, 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fil. Fam. 16, 21, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Graecia cotidie magis et magis cogito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 18, 4</bibl></cit>; <cb n="MAGN" /> 16, 3, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:90:308" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 90, 308</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 32, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 8, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">magis deinde ac magis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post hoc magis ac magis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gram. 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which also: magisque ac magis deinceps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 8</bibl>; Sen. de Ira, 3, 1, 4; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 114, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 2, 14, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 28, 3</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> also: <cit><quote lang="la">magis atque magis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 239</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">post, vento crescente, magis magis increbescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 64, 275</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 311</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27649.28" n="3" level="3"> Pleon. </sense><sense id="n27649.29" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">potius</hi> (anteclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">magis decorum'st Libertum potius quam patronum onus in via portare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi magis lubet cum probis potius quam cum improbis vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27649.30" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">malle</hi>: quam cum lego, nihil malo quam has res relinquere; <cit><quote lang="la">his vero auditis multo magis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:31:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 31, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finge enim malle eum magis suum consequi quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:52:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 2, 52, § 10</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n27649.31" n="C" level="2"> In partic.: non (neque) magis quam. </sense><sense id="n27649.32" n="1" level="3"> To signify perfect equality between two enunciations, <hi rend="ital">no more ... than; just as much ... as;</hi> or neg., <hi rend="ital">no more ... than; just as little ... as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus erat non domino magis ornamento quam civitati,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>just as much to the city as to its owner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:3:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 3, § 5</bibl></cit>; Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non Hannibale magis victo a se quam Q. Fabio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conficior enim maerore, mea Terentia, nec me meae miseriae magis excruciant quam tuae vestraeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 22</bibl>.— Neg.: qui est enim animus in aliquo morbo ... non magis est sanus, quam id corpus, quod in morbo est, i. e. <hi rend="ital">is just as far from being sound as a body</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 5, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si aliquā in re Verris similis fuero, non magis mihi deerit inimicus quam Verri defuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:69:section=162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 69, § 162</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:8:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 8, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non nascitur itaque ex malo bonum, non magis quam ficus ex olea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87, 25</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Quint. prooem. § 26: non magis Gaium imperaturum, quam per Baianum sinum equis discursurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 19</bibl></cit>. —Ellipt.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec eo magis lege liberi sunto,</quote> <trans><tr>just as little from that as from the rest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:4:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 4, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27649.33" n="2" level="3"> For restricting the idea expressed in the clause with non magis, so that <hi rend="ital">not more</hi>, according to a common figure of speech, = <hi rend="ital">less;</hi> in Engl. <hi rend="ital">not so much ... as; less ... than</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde credas mihi affirmanti velim, me hoc non pro Lysone magis quam pro omnibus scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 24</bibl></cit>; Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserebat non poenae magis homines, quam sceleris, quo poenam meriti essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27649.34" n="3" level="3"> Magis minusve, magis aut minus, or magis ac minus; post-Aug. for the usual plus minusve, <hi rend="ital">more or less</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed istud magis minusve vitiosum est pro personis dicentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 220</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">minora vero plerumque sunt talia, ut pro persona, tempore, loco, causa magis ac minus vel excusata debeant videri vel reprehendenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 18, § 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam tamen et nationibus puto magis aut minus convenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 40:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 40, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quosdam minus aut magis osos veritatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Suas. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut minus, aut magis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 82:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 82, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27649.35" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">alius ... alio</hi>, etc.: ceterae philosophorum disciplinae, omnino alia magis alia, sed tamen omnes, <hi rend="ital">one more than another</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in different degrees</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:3:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 3, 11</bibl> Madvig. ad loc. (al.: <cit><quote lang="la">alia magis, alia minus, v. Hand, Turs. III. p. 560): mihi videntur omnes quidem illi errasse ... sed alius alio magis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:16:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 16, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt omnino omnes fere similes, sed declarant communis notiones, alia magis alia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:24:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 24, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii aliis magis recusare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 15, 11</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">maxĭmē (maxŭmē</orth>), <hi rend="ital">in the highest degree, most of all, most particularly, especially, exceedingly, very</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n27649.36" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27649.37" n="1" level="3"> Alone. </sense><sense id="n27649.38" n="a" level="4"> With a <hi rend="ital">verb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec una res in omni libero populo maximeque in pacatis tranquillisque civitatibus praecipue semper floruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid commemorem primum aut laudem maxime?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 9, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos coluit maxime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem convenire maxime cupiebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 4, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 133</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de te audiebamus ea, quae maxime vellemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 25</bibl></cit>, a, 7; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra quos (fines) egredi non possim, si maxime velim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 10, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in re publica maxime conservanda sunt jura belli,</quote> <trans><tr>most especially</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 11, 33</bibl></cit>: huic legioni Caesar propter virtutem confidebat maxime,<pb n="1101" /> <cb n="MAGN" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem Homero crederet maxime accedere,</quote> <trans><tr>came nearest to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:86" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 86</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pugnare,</quote> <trans><tr>most violently</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 271</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubere,</quote> <trans><tr>most positively</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id enim est profecto, quod constituta religione rem publicam contineat maxime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:27:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 27, 69</bibl></cit>; cf. maxime <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab eo exordiri volui maxime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cernere naturae vim maxime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:15:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 15, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27649.39" n="b" level="4"> With an <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">res maxime necessaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 23, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca maxime frumentaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci ad hoc maxime idonei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxime naturali carent amicitiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 21, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxime feri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui eo tempore maxime plebi acceptus erat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">īdem ad augendam eloquentiam maxime accommodati erunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elegans maxime auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxime vero commune est quaerere, an sit honesta? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noto enim maxime utar exemplo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—So with <hi rend="ital">supp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae maxime liberalissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:38:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 38, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxime gravissimam omniumque (rerum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 23, 4</bibl></cit> MS. (dub.: maxumam gravissimamque, Weissenb.). —</sense><sense id="n27649.40" n="c" level="4"> With numerals, <hi rend="ital">at most</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer ad annos maxime natus octo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:8:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n27649.41" n="d" level="4"> With an <pos>adv.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut dicatis quam maxime ad veritatem accommodate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 149</bibl></cit> (v. infra 2).—</sense><sense id="n27649.42" n="2" level="3"> Strengthened by <hi rend="ital">unus, unus omnium, omnium, multo, vel, tam, quam</hi>, etc. (supply potest): <cit><quote lang="la">qui proelium unus maxime accenderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:2:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum suā modestiā unus omnium maxime floreret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae maxime omnium belli avida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 59</bibl>; cf. Drak. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 19, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque ea res multo maxime disjunxit illum ab illa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium populi Romani multo maxime miserabile visum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 36, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud mihi videtur vel maxime confirmare, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:65:162" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 65, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc enim uno praestamus vel maxime feris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae quidem vel maxime suspicionem movent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:33:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 33, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam potes, tam verba confer maxime ad compendium,</quote> <trans><tr>as much as possible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego jubeo quam maxime unam facere nos hanc familiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quam maxime permaneant diuturna corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:45:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 45, 108</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:34:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 34, 154</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo mihi rectius videtur, memoriam nostri quam maxime longam efficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceterum illum juvenem incipere a quam maxime facili ac favorabili causa velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 6, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27649.43" n="3" level="3"> With the relative <hi rend="ital">qui</hi> in the phrases, quam qui maxime and ut qui maxime: <cit><quote lang="la">tam enim sum amicus rei publicae, quam qui maxime,</quote> <trans><tr>as any one whatever</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grata ea res, ut quae maxime senatui umquam fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n27649.44" n="4" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ut quisque ... ita</hi> (maxime, potissimum or minime), <hi rend="ital">the more ... the more</hi> (or <hi rend="ital">less</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc maxime officii est, ut quisque maxime opis indigeat, ita ei potissimum opitulari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 15, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque magnitudine animae maxime excellit, ita maxime, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 19, 64</bibl></cit>;
