cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, in the contrary order: colendum autem esse ita quemque maxime, ut quisque maxime virtutibus his lenioribus erit ornatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut enim quisque maxime ad suum commodum refert, quaecumque agit, ita minime est vir bonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:18:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 18, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27649.45" n="5" level="3"> In gradations, to denote the first and most desirable, <hi rend="ital">first of all, in the first place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus industriam maxime quidem vellem, ut imitarentur ii, quos oportebat: secundo autem loco, ne alterius labori inviderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 10, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 9, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si per eum reductus insidiose redissem, me scilicet maxime sed proxime illum quoque fefellissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo genere sunt maxime oves, deinde caprae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxime ... dein,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 16, 23, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed vitem maxime populus videtur alere, deinde ulmus, post etiam fraxinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxime ... deinde ... postea ... minume,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 12, 75, § 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxime ... postea ... ultimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:3:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post Chium maxime laudatur Creticum, mox Aegyptium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 17, § 77</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n27649.46" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n27649.47" n="1" level="3"> Like potissimum, to give prominence to an idea, <hi rend="ital">especially, particularly, principally</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae ratio poetas, maximeque Homerum impulit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:6:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 6, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:51:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 51, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribe aliquid, et maxime, si Pompeius Italiā cedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cb n="MAGU" /> de Cocceio et Libone quae scribis, approbo: <cit><quote lang="la">maxime quod de judicatu meo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 19, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognoscat etiam rerum gestarum et memoriae veteris ordinem, maxime scilicet nostrae civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:34:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 34, 120</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 1, 2</bibl>.—So in the connection, cum ... tum maxime; tum ... tum maxime; ut ... tum maxime, <hi rend="ital">but more especially</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scio et perspexi saepe: cum antehac, tum hodie maxime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plena exemplorum est nostra res publica, cum saepe, tum maxime bello Punico secundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:11:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 11, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 38, 94</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum exercitationibus crebris atque magnis, tum scribendo maxime persequatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:23:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 23, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longius autem procedens, ut in ceteris eloquentiae partibus, tum maxime, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:93:320" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 93, 320</bibl></cit>.— With nunc, nuper, tum, cum, <hi rend="ital">just, precisely, exactly: Me.</hi> Quid? vostrum patri Filii quot eratis? <hi rend="ital">M. Su.</hi> Ut nunc maxime memini, duo, <hi rend="ital">just now</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum iis, quos nuper maxime liberaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse tum maxime admoto igne refovebat artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:4:25" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 4, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:6:10" default="NO">6, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:7:2" default="NO">5, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 4, 2</bibl> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec cum maxime loqueretur, sex lictores eum circumsistunt valentissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:54:section=142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 54, § 142</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 76</bibl>, § 187; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 4, 38, § 72: totius autem injustitiae nulla capitalior, quam eorum, qui cum maxime fallunt, id agunt, ut viri boni esse videantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:13:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 13, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:33" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum cum maxime,</quote> <trans><tr>at that precise time, at that moment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:32:1" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 32, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 9, 3</bibl>; 43, 7, 8; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tunc cum maxime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:2:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc cum maxime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 11, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 17, 7</bibl>; v. 2. cum.—</sense><sense id="n27649.48" n="2" level="3"> In colloquial lang., to denote emphatic assent, <hi rend="ital">certainly, by all means, very well, yes;</hi> and with immo, to express emphatic dissent, <hi rend="ital">certainly not, by no means: Ar.</hi> Jace, pater, talos, ut porro nos jaciamus. <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> Maxime, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 36</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Nisi quid magis Es occupatus, operam mihi da. <hi rend="ital">Si.</hi> Maxime, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 5, 23</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Ca.</hi> Numquid peccatum est, Simo? <hi rend="ital">Si.</hi> Immo maxime, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scilicet res ipsa aspera est, sed vos non timetis eam. Immo vero maxime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 28</bibl></cit> (v. immo); v. Hand, Turs. III. p. 552-607.</sense></entryFree>
